 sonnets



 fairest creatures desire increase
 thereby beauty ’ rose might never die
 riper time decease
 tender heir might bear memory
 thou contracted thine bright eyes
 feed ’ st thy light ’ flame selfsubstantial fuel
 making famine abundance lies
 thy self thy foe thy sweet self cruel
 thou art world ’ fresh ornament
 herald gaudy spring
 within thine bud buriest thy content
 tender churl mak ’ st waste niggarding
 pity world else glutton
 eat world ’ due grave thee




 forty winters shall besiege thy brow
 dig deep trenches thy beauty ’ field
 thy youth ’ proud livery gazed
 tattered weed small worth held
 asked thy beauty lies
 treasure thy lusty days
 say within thine deep sunken eyes
 alleating shame thriftless praise
 much praise deserv ’ thy beauty ’ use
 thou couldst answer ‘ fair child mine
 shall sum count make old excuse ’
 proving beauty succession thine
 new made thou art old
 see thy blood warm thou feel ’ st cold




 look thy glass tell face thou viewest
 time face form another
 whose fresh repair thou renewest
 thou dost beguile world unbless mother
 fair whose uneared womb
 disdains tillage thy husbandry
 fond tomb
 selflove stop posterity
 thou art thy mother ’ glass thee
 calls back lovely april prime
 thou windows thine age shalt see
 despite wrinkles thy golden time
 thou live remembered
 die single thine image dies thee




 unthrifty loveliness dost thou spend
 upon thy self thy beauty ’ legacy
 nature ’ bequest gives nothing doth lend
 frank lends free
 beauteous niggard dost thou abuse
 bounteous largess given thee give
 profitless usurer dost thou use
 great sum sums yet canst live
 traffic thy self alone
 thou thy self thy sweet self dost deceive
 nature calls thee gone
 acceptable audit canst thou leave
 thy unused beauty must tombed thee
 used lives th ’ executor




 hours gentle work frame
 lovely gaze every eye doth dwell

 unfair fairly doth excel

 let winter ’ ragged hand deface
 thee thy summer ere thou distilled
 make sweet vial treasure thou place
 beauty ’ treasure ere selfkilled
 use forbidden usury
 happies pay willing loan
 ’ thy self breed another thee
 ten times happier ten one
 ten times thy self happier thou art
 ten thine ten times refigured thee
 could death thou shouldst depart
 leaving thee living posterity
 selfwilled thou art much fair
 death ’ conquest make worms thine heir




 lo orient gracious light

 music hear hear ’ st thou music sadly
 sweets sweets war joy delights joy
 lov ’ st thou thou receiv ’ st gladly
 else receiv ’ st pleasure thine annoy

 fear wet widow ’ eye
 thou consum ’ st thy self single life
 ah thou issueless shalt hap die
 world wail thee like makeless wife
 world thy widow still weep
 thou form thee hast left behind
 every private widow well may keep
 children ’ eyes husband ’ shape mind

 thy self art unprovident

 shall hate fairer lodged gentle love

 fast thou shalt wane fast thou grow ’ st
 one thine thou departest
 fresh blood youngly thou bestow ’ st
 thou mayst call thine thou youth convertest
 herein lives wisdom beauty increase
 without folly age cold decay
 minded times cease

 count clock tells time
 see brave day sunk hideous night
 behold violet past prime

 shall compare thee summer ’ day
 thou art lovely temperate

 thou art blamed shall thy defect
 slander ’ mark ever yet fair

 time year thou mayst behold

 thou perceiv ’ st makes thy love strong
 love well thou must leave ere long

 thoughts food life
 sweetseasoned showers ground
 peace hold strife
 ’ twixt miser wealth found
 proud enjoyer anon

 counting best alone

 sometime full feasting sight

 verse barren new pride
 far variation quick change
 time glance aside
 newfound methods compounds strange
 write still one ever
 keep invention noted weed
 every word doth almost tell name

 act scene orchard olivers house

 enter orlando adam

 orlando remember adam upon fashion bequeathed
 poor thousand crowns thou sayst charged
 brother blessing breed well begins
 sadness brother jaques keeps school report speaks
 goldenly profit part keeps rustically home
 speak properly stays home unkept call
 keeping gentleman birth differs
 stalling ox horses bred better besides
 fair feeding taught manage
 end riders dearly hird brother gain nothing
 growth animals dunghills
 much bound besides nothing
 plentifully gives something nature gave
 countenance seems take lets feed hinds
 bars place brother much lies mines
 gentility education adam grieves
 spirit father think within begins mutiny
 servitude longer endure though yet know
 wise remedy avoid

 enter oliver

 adam yonder comes master brother
 orlando go apart adam thou shalt hear shake
 adam retires
 oliver sir make
 orlando nothing taught make thing
 oliver mar sir
 orlando marry sir helping mar god made
 poor unworthy brother idleness
 oliver marry sir better employed nought awhile
 orlando shall keep hogs eat husks
 prodigal portion spent come penury
 oliver know sir
 orlando sir well orchard
 oliver know sir
 orlando ay better knows know
 eldest brother gentle condition blood
 know courtesy nations allows better
 firstborn tradition takes
 away blood twenty brothers betwixt us
 much father albeit confess coming
 nearer reverence
 oliver boy strikes
 orlando come come elder brother young
 oliver wilt thou lay hands villain
 orlando villain youngest son sir rowland de
 boys father thrice villain says
 father begot villains wert thou brother would
 take hand thy throat till pulld thy
 tongue saying thou raild thyself
 adam coming forward sweet masters patient fathers
 remembrance accord
 oliver let go say
 orlando till please shall hear father
 chargd give good education
 traind like peasant obscuring hiding
 gentlemanlike qualities spirit father grows strong
 longer endure therefore allow
 exercises may become gentleman give poor
 allottery father left testament go buy
 fortunes

 act iii scene palace

 enter duke frederick oliver lords

 enter oliver

 oliver good morrow fair ones pray know
 purlieus forest stands

 man

 left promise return
 within hour pacing forest
 chewing food sweet bitter fancy
 lo befell threw eye aside
 mark object present
 oak whose boughs mossd age
 high top bald dry antiquity
 wretched ragged man oergrown hair
 lay sleeping back neck

 head nimble threats approachd
 opening mouth suddenly
 seeing orlando unlinkd
 indented glides slip away

 lay couching head ground catlike watch

 royal disposition beast
 prey nothing doth seem dead

 found brother elder brother

 tell since conversion
 sweetly tastes thing

 oliver

 partial infringe laws

 seal ’ rigorous statutes bloods

 hath solemn synods decreed

 unto woman happy

 liv ’ joy wealth increas ’
 prosperous voyages often made

 great care goods random left
 drew kind embracements spouse

 pleasing punishment women bear

 long became

 could distinguish ’ names

 mean woman delivered

 came aboard

 alwayswindobeying deep

 obscured light heavens grant
 convey unto fearful minds
 doubtful warrant immediate death
 though would gladly embrac ’

 forc ’ seek delays

 gods done
 worthily term ’ merciless us
 ere ships could meet twice five leagues

 enter antipholus syracuse

 think ’ st thou jest hold take thou

 time thou unurg ’ wouldst vow
 never words music thine ear
 never object pleasing thine eye
 never touch well welcome thy hand
 never meat sweetsavour ’ thy taste
 unless spake look ’ touch ’ carv ’ thee
 comes husband comes
 thou art estranged thyself
 thyself call strange
 undividable incorporate
 better thy dear self ’ better part
 ah tear away thyself
 know love easy mayst thou fall
 drop water breaking gulf
 take unmingled thence drop
 without addition diminishing
 take thyself
 dearly would touch thee quick
 ’ st thou hear licentious
 body consecrate thee
 ruffian lust contaminate
 wouldst thou spit spurn
 hurl name husband face
 tear stain ’ skin harlot brow
 false hand cut weddingring
 break deepdivorcing vow
 know thou canst therefore see thou
 possess ’ adulterate blot
 blood mingled crime lust
 two one thou play false
 digest poison thy flesh
 strumpeted thy contagion
 keep fair league truce thy true bed
 live distain ’ thou undishonoured

 antipholus syracuse
 plead fair dame know
 ephesus two hours old
 strange unto town talk
 every word wit scann ’
 wants wit one word understand

 luciana
 fie brother world chang ’
 wont use sister thus
 sent dromio home dinner

 dromio syracuse

 buffet thee blows

 didst thou deliver mart

 never spake life

 antipholus syracuse
 thus call us names
 unless inspiration

 adriana
 ill agrees gravity
 counterfeit thus grossly slave
 abetting thwart mood
 wrong exempt
 wrong wrong contempt
 come fasten sleeve thine
 thou art elm husband vine
 whose weakness married thy stronger state
 makes thy strength communicate
 aught possess thee dross
 usurping ivy brier idle moss
 want pruning intrusion
 infect thy sap live thy confusion

 scene ii

 enter luciana antipholus syracuse

 luciana
 may quite forgot
 husband ’ office shall antipholus

 scene ii corioli senate house

 know proceed

 whether east west dearth great
 people mutinous rumourd

 rome worse hated

 scene iii rome marcius house

 enter volumnia virgilia mother wife marcius set
 two low stools sew

 volumnia pray daughter sing express
 comfortable sort son husband freelier
 rejoice absence wherein honour
 embracements bed would show love yet
 tenderbodied son womb youth
 comeliness pluckd gaze way day
 kings entreaties mother sell hour
 beholding considering honour would become person
 better picturelike hang th wall
 renown made stir pleasd let seek danger
 find fame cruel war sent whence
 returnd brows bound oak tell thee daughter
 sprang joy first hearing manchild
 first seeing proved man
 virgilia died business madam
 volumnia good report son therein
 would found issue hear profess sincerely dozen
 sons love alike none less dear thine
 good marcius rather eleven die nobly country
 one voluptuously surfeit action

 unite commutual sacred bands

 many journeys may sun moon
 make us count ’ er ere love done

 hamlet
 aside wormwood wormwood

 player queen
 instances second marriage move
 base respects thrift none love
 second time kill husband dead
 second husband kisses bed

 player king
 believe think speak
 determine oft break
 purpose slave memory
 violent birth poor validity
 like fruit unripe sticks tree
 fall unshaken mellow
 necessary ’ tis forget
 pay debt
 passion propose
 passion ending doth purpose lose
 violence either grief joy
 enactures destroy
 joy revels grief doth lament
 grief joys joy grieves slender accident
 world aye ’ tis strange
 even loves fortunes change
 ’ tis question left us yet prove
 whether love lead fortune else fortune love
 great man mark favourite flies
 poor advanc ’ makes friends enemies
 hitherto doth love fortune tend
 needs shall never lack friend
 want hollow friend doth try
 directly seasons enemy
 orderly end begun
 wills fates contrary run
 devices still overthrown
 thoughts ends none
 think thou wilt second husband wed
 die thy thoughts thy first lord dead

 player queen
 earth give food heaven light
 sport repose lock day night
 desperation turn trust hope
 anchor ’ cheer prison scope
 opposite blanks face joy
 meet would well destroy

 enter lady percy

 kate must leave within two hours

 lady percy
 good lord thus alone
 offence fortnight
 banish ’ woman harry ’ bed
 tell sweet lord ’ takes thee
 thy stomach pleasure thy golden sleep
 dost thou bend thine eyes upon earth
 start often thou sitt ’ st alone
 hast thou lost fresh blood thy cheeks
 given treasures rights thee
 thickeyed musing curst melancholy
 thy faint slumbers thee watch ’
 heard thee murmur tales iron wars
 speak terms manage thy bounding steed
 cry courage field thou hast talk ’
 sallies retires trenches tents
 palisadoes frontiers parapets
 basilisks cannon culverin
 prisoners ransomed soldiers slain
 currents heady fight
 thy spirit within thee hath war
 thus hath bestirr ’ thee thy sleep
 beads sweat stood upon thy brow
 like bubbles latedisturbed stream
 thy face strange motions appear ’
 see men restrain breath
 great sudden hest portents
 heavy business hath lord hand
 must know else loves

 scene ii london room palace

 enter king henry prince henry lords

 king
 lords give us leave prince wales
 must private conference near hand
 shall presently need

 exeunt lords

 know whether god
 displeasing service done
 secret doom blood
 ’ breed revengement scourge
 thou dost thy passages life
 make believe thou art mark ’
 hot vengeance rod heaven
 punish mistreadings tell else
 could inordinate low desires
 poor base lewd mean attempts
 barren pleasures rude society
 thou art match ’ withal grafted
 accompany greatness thy blood
 hold level thy princely heart

 prince
 please majesty would could
 quit offences clear excuse
 well doubtless purge
 many charged withal
 yet extenuation let beg
 reproof many tales devised
 smiling pickthanks base newsmongers—
 oft ear greatness needs must hear—
 may things true wherein youth
 hath faulty wander ’ irregular
 find pardon true submission

 king
 god pardon thee yet let wonder harry
 thy affections hold wing
 quite flight thy ancestors
 thy place council thou hast rudely lost
 thy younger brother supplied
 art almost alien hearts
 court princes blood
 hope expectation thy time
 ruin ’ soul every man
 prophetically forethink thy fall
 lavish presence
 commonhackney ’ eyes men
 stale cheap vulgar company
 opinion help crown
 still kept loyal possession
 left reputeless banishment

 fellow mark likelihood
 seldom seen could stir
 like comet wonder ’
 men would tell children
 others would say bolingbroke
 stole courtesy heaven
 dress ’ humility
 pluck allegiance men ’ hearts
 loud shouts salutations mouths
 even presence crowned king
 thus keep person fresh new
 presence like robe pontifical
 ne ’ er seen wonder ’ state
 seldom sumptuous showed like feast
 rareness solemnity
 skipping king ambled
 shallow jesters rash bavin wits
 soon kindled soon burnt carded state
 mingled royalty capering fools
 great name profaned scorns
 gave countenance name
 laugh gibing boys stand push
 every beardless vain comparative
 grew companion common streets
 enfeoff ’ popularity
 dally swallow ’ men ’ eyes
 surfeited honey began
 loathe taste sweetness whereof little
 little much much
 occasion seen
 cuckoo june
 heard regarded seen eyes
 sick blunted community
 afford extraordinary gaze
 bent sunlike majesty
 shines seldom admiring eyes
 rather drowsed hung eyelids
 slept face render ’ aspect
 cloudy men use adversaries
 presence glutted gorged full
 line harry stand ’ st thou
 thou hast lost thy princely privilege
 vile participation eye
 aweary thy common sight
 save mine hath desired see thee
 doth would
 make blind foolish tenderness

 prince
 shall hereafter thricegracious lord


 king
 world
 thou art hour richard
 france set foot ravenspurg
 even percy
 sceptre soul boot
 hath worthy interest state
 thou shadow succession
 right colour like right
 doth fill fields harness realm
 turns head lion ’ armed jaws
 debt years thou
 leads ancient lords reverend bishops
 bloody battles bruising arms
 neverdying honour hath got
 renowned douglas whose high deeds
 whose hot incursions great name arms
 holds soldiers chief majority
 military title capital
 kingdoms acknowledge christ
 thrice hath hotspur mars swathingclothes
 infant warrior enterprises
 discomfited great douglas ta ’ en
 enlarged made friend
 fill mouth deep defiance
 shake peace safety throne
 say percy northumberland
 th ’ archbishop ’ grace york douglas mortimer
 capitulate us
 wherefore tell news thee
 harry tell thee foes
 art near ’ st dearest enemy
 thou art like enough—through vassal fear
 base inclination start spleen—
 fight percy ’ pay
 dog heels curtsy frowns
 show much thou art degenerate

 prince
 think shall find
 god forgive much sway ’
 majesty ’ good thoughts away
 redeem percy ’ head
 closing glorious day
 bold tell son
 wear garment blood
 stain favour bloody mask
 wash ’ away shall scour shame
 shall day whene ’ er lights
 child honour renown
 gallant hotspur allpraised knight
 unthoughtof harry chance meet
 every honour sitting helm
 would multitudes head
 shames redoubled time come
 shall make northern youth exchange
 glorious deeds indignities
 percy factor good lord
 ’ engross glorious deeds behalf
 call hall strict account
 shall render every glory
 yea even slightest worship time
 tear reckoning heart
 name god promise
 perform survive
 beseech majesty may salve
 longgrown wounds intemperance
 end life cancels bands
 die hundred thousand deaths
 ere break smallest parcel vow

 enter chorus

 chorus
 thus far rough allunable pen
 bending author hath pursu ’ story
 little room confining mighty men
 mangling starts full course glory
 small time small greatly lived
 star england fortune made sword

 left son imperial lord

 france england king succeed
 whose state many managing
 lost france made england bleed

 scene england france

 first part king henry sixth

 act scene

 westminster abbey

 dead march enter funeral king henry fifth attended
 duke bedford regent france duke gloucester
 protector duke exeter earl warwick bishop
 winchester

 bedford hung heavens black yield day
 night comets importing change times states
 brandish crystal tresses sky
 scourge bad revolting stars
 consented unto henrys death
 king henry fifth famous live long
 england neer lost king much worth
 gloucester england neer king time
 virtue deserving command
 brandishd sword blind men beams
 arms spread wider dragons wings
 sparkling eyes replete wrathful fire
 dazzled drove back enemies
 midday sun fierce bent faces
 say deeds exceed speech
 neer lift hand conquered
 exeter mourn black mourn blood
 henry dead never shall revive
 upon wooden coffin attend
 deaths dishonourable victory
 stately presence glorify
 like captives bound triumphant car
 shall curse planets mishap
 plotted thus glorys overthrow
 shall think subtlewitted french
 conjurers sorcerers afraid
 magic verses contrivd end
 winchester king blessd king kings
 unto french dreadful judgmentday
 dreadful sight
 battles lord hosts fought
 churchs prayers made prosperous
 gloucester church churchmen
 prayd
 thread life soon decayd
 none like effeminate prince
 like schoolboy may overawe
 winchester gloucester whateer like thou art
 protector
 lookest command prince realm
 thy wife proud holdeth thee awe
 god religious churchmen may
 gloucester name religion thou lovst flesh
 neer throughout year church thou gost
 except pray thy foes
 bedford cease cease jars rest minds peace
 lets altar heralds wait us
 instead gold well offer arms
 since arms avail henrys dead
 posterity await wretched years
 mothers moistned eyes babes shall suck
 isle made nourish salt tears
 none women left wail dead
 henry fifth thy ghost invocate
 prosper realm keep civil broils
 combat adverse planets heavens
 far glorious star thy soul make
 julius caesar bright

 enter messenger

 messenger honourable lords health
 sad tidings bring france
 loss slaughter discomfiture
 guienne champagne rheims orleans

 third thinks without expense
 guileful fair words peace may obtaind

 scene

 london temple garden

 enter earls somerset suffolk warwick
 richard plantagenet vernon another lawyer

 plantagenet great lords gentlemen means
 silence
 dare man answer case truth
 suffolk within temple hall loud
 garden convenient
 plantagenet say maintaind truth
 else wrangling somerset th error
 suffolk faith truant law
 never yet could frame
 therefore frame law unto
 somerset judge lord warwick us
 warwick two hawks flies higher pitch
 two dogs hath deeper mouth
 two blades bears better temper
 two horses doth bear best
 two girls hath merriest eye
 perhaps shallow spirit judgment
 nice sharp quillets law
 good faith wiser daw
 plantagenet tut tut mannerly forbearance
 truth appears naked side
 purblind eye may find
 somerset side well apparelld
 clear shining evident
 glimmer blind mans eye
 plantagenet since tonguetied loath speak
 dumb significants proclaim thoughts
 let trueborn gentleman
 stands upon honour birth
 suppose pleaded truth
 brier pluck white rose
 somerset let coward flatterer
 dare maintain party truth
 pluck red rose thorn
 warwick love colours without colour
 base insinuating flattery
 pluck white rose plantagenet
 suffolk pluck red rose young somerset
 say withal think held right
 vernon stay lords gentlemen pluck
 till conclude upon whose side
 fewest roses croppd tree
 shall yield right opinion
 somerset good master vernon well objected
 fewest subscribe silence
 plantagenet
 vernon truth plainness case
 pluck pale maiden blossom
 giving verdict white rose side

 lest bleeding paint white rose red
 fall side

 keep side still

 lawyer somerset unless study books
 false
 argument held wrong
 sign whereof pluck white rose

 somerset scabbard meditating
 shall dye white rose bloody red
 plantagenet meantime cheeks counterfeit
 roses

 truth side
 somerset plantagenet
 tis fear anger thy cheeks
 blush pure shame counterfeit roses
 yet thy tongue confess thy error
 plantagenet hath thy rose canker somerset
 somerset hath thy rose thorn plantagenet
 plantagenet ay sharp piercing maintain truth
 whiles thy consuming canker eats falsehood
 somerset well ill find friends wear bleeding roses
 shall maintain said true
 false plantagenet dare seen
 plantagenet maiden blossom hand
 scorn thee thy fashion peevish boy
 suffolk turn thy scorns way plantagenet
 plantagenet proud pole scorn
 thee
 suffolk ill turn part thereof thy throat
 somerset away away good william de la pole
 grace yeoman conversing
 warwick gods thou wrongst somerset
 grandfather lionel duke clarence
 third son third edward king england
 spring crestless yeomen deep root
 plantagenet bears places privilege
 durst craven heart say thus
 somerset made ill maintain words
 plot ground christendom
 thy father richard earl cambridge
 treason executed late kings days
 treason standst thou attainted
 corrupted exempt ancient gentry
 trespass yet lives guilty thy blood
 till thou restord thou art yeoman
 plantagenet father attached attainted
 condemnd die treason traitor
 ill prove better men somerset
 growing time ripened
 partaker pole
 ill note book memory
 scourge apprehension
 look well say well warnd
 somerset ay thou shalt find us ready thee still
 know us colours thy foes
 friends spite thee shall wear
 plantagenet soul pale angry rose
 cognizance blooddrinking hate
 ever faction wear
 wither grave
 flourish height degree

 farewell meet thee next exit

 richard exit

 warwick blot object house
 shall wipd next parliament
 calld truce winchester gloucester
 thou created york
 live accounted warwick
 meantime signal love thee
 proud somerset william pole
 upon thy party wear rose
 prophesy brawl today
 grown faction temple garden
 shall send red rose white
 thousand souls death deadly night

 behalf would pluck flower

 lawyer

 scene

 tower london

 enter mortimer brought chair gaolers

 mortimer kind keepers weak decaying age
 let dying mortimer rest
 even like man new haled rack
 fare limbs long imprisonment
 grey locks pursuivants death
 nestorlike aged age care
 argue end edmund mortimer
 eyes like lamps whose wasting oil spent
 wax dim drawing exigent
 weak shoulders overborne burdening grief
 pithless arms like withered vine
 droops sapless branches ground
 yet feet whose strengthless stay numb
 unable support lump clay
 swiftwinged desire get grave
 witting comfort
 tell keeper nephew come
 first keeper richard plantagenet lord come
 sent unto temple unto chamber
 answer returnd come
 mortimer enough soul shall satisfied
 poor gentleman wrong doth equal mine
 since henry monmouth first began reign
 whose glory great arms
 loathsome sequestration
 even since hath richard obscurd
 deprivd honour inheritance
 arbitrator despairs
 death kind umpire mens miseries
 sweet enlargement doth dismiss hence
 would troubles likewise expird
 might recover lost

 enter richard plantagenet

 first keeper lord loving nephew come
 mortimer richard plantagenet friend come
 plantagenet ay noble uncle thus ignobly usd
 nephew late despised richard comes
 mortimer direct mine arms may embrace neck
 bosom spend latter gasp
 tell lips touch cheeks
 may kindly give one fainting kiss
 declare sweet stem yorks great stock
 didst thou say late thou wert despisd
 plantagenet first lean thine aged back mine arm
 ease ill tell thee disease
 day argument upon case
 words grew twixt somerset
 among terms usd lavish tongue
 upbraid fathers death
 obloquy set bars tongue
 else like requited
 therefore good uncle fathers sake
 honour true plantagenet
 alliance sake declare cause
 father earl cambridge lost head
 mortimer cause fair nephew imprisond
 hath detaind flowring youth
 within loathsome dungeon pine
 cursed instrument decease
 plantagenet discover large cause
 ignorant guess
 mortimer fading breath permit
 death approach ere tale done
 henry fourth grandfather king
 deposd nephew richard edwards son
 firstbegotten lawful heir
 edward king third descent
 whose reign percies north
 finding usurpation unjust
 endeavourd advancement throne
 reason movd warlike lords
 thatyoung richard thus removd
 leaving heir begotten body
 next birth parentage
 mother derived
 lionel duke clarence third son
 king edward third whereas
 john gaunt doth bring pedigree
 fourth heroic line
 mark haughty great attempt
 laboured plant rightful heir
 lost liberty lives
 long henry fifth
 succeeding father bolingbroke reign
 thy father earl cambridge derivd
 famous edmund langley duke york
 marrying sister thy mother
 pity hard distress
 levied army weening redeem
 installd diadem
 rest fell noble earl
 beheaded thus mortimers
 title rested suppressd
 plantagenet lord honour last
 mortimer true thou seest issue
 fainting words warrant death
 thou art heir rest wish thee gather
 yet wary thy studious care
 plantagenet thy grave admonishments prevail
 yet methinks fathers execution
 nothing less bloody tyranny
 mortimer silence nephew thou politic
 strong fixed house lancaster
 like mountain removd
 thy uncle removing hence
 princes courts cloyd
 long continuance settled place
 plantagenet uncle would part young years
 might redeem passage age
 mortimer thou dost wrong slaughterer
 doth
 giveth many wounds one kill
 mourn except thou sorrow good
 give order funeral
 farewell fair thy hopes
 prosperous thy life peace war dies
 plantagenet peace war befall thy parting soul
 prison hast thou spent pilgrimage
 like hermit overpassd thy days
 well lock counsel breast
 imagine let rest
 keepers convey hence
 see burial better life
 exeunt gaolers hearing body mortimer
 dies dusky torch mortimer
 chokd ambition meaner sort
 wrongs bitter injuries
 somerset hath offerd house
 doubt honour redress
 therefore haste parliament
 either restored blood
 make ill th advantage good exit

 patience

 enter sir william lucy

 somerset sir william whither sent
 lucy whither lord bought sold lord
 talbot
 ringd bold adversity
 cries noble york somerset
 beat assailing death weak legions
 whiles honourable captain
 drops bloody sweat warwearied limbs
 advantage lingring looks rescue
 false hopes trust englands honour
 keep aloof worthless emulation
 let private discord keep away
 levied succours lend aid
 renowned noble gentleman
 yield life unto world odds
 orleans bastard charles burgundy
 alencon reignier compass
 talbot perisheth default
 somerset york set york sent aid
 lucy york fast upon grace exclaims
 swearing withhold levied host
 collected expedition
 somerset york lies might sent horse
 owe little duty less love
 take foul scorn fawn sending
 lucy fraud england force france
 hath entrappd noble minded talbot

 scene iv london street

 enter duke humphrey men mourning cloaks

 gloucester thus sometimes hath brightest day cloud
 summer evermore succeeds
 barren winter wrathful nipping cold
 cares joys abound seasons fleet
 sirs whats oclock
 servingman ten lord
 gloucester ten hour appointed
 watch coming punishd duchess
 uneath may endure flinty streets
 tread tenderfeeling feet
 sweet nell ill thy noble mind abrook
 abject people gazing thy face
 envious looks laughing thy shame
 erst follow thy proud chariot wheels
 thou didst ride triumph streets
 soft think comes ill prepare
 tearstaind eyes see miseries

 enter duchess gloucester white sheet
 taper burning hand sir john
 stanley sheriff officers

 servingman please grace well take sheriff

 enter iden

 seek wax great others waning

 sufficeth maintains state
 sends poor well pleased gate

 alexander iden esquire kent

 thy hand finger fist

 enter old clifford

 warwick one us time come

 must hunt deer death

 intend clifford thrive today
 grieves soul leave thee unassaild exit
 clifford seest thou york dost thou pause
 york thy brave bearing love

 tis shown ignobly treason

 york dreadful lay address thee instantly

 peace soul heaven thy exit

 enter young clifford

 young clifford shame confusion rout
 fear frames disorder disorder wounds
 guard war thou son hell
 angry heavens make minister
 throw frozen bosoms part
 hot coals vengeance let soldier fly
 truly dedicate war
 hath selflove loves
 hath essentially circumstance
 name valour sees fathers body
 let vile world end
 premised flames last day
 knit earth heaven together
 let general trumpet blow blast
 particularities petty sounds
 cease wast thou ordaind dear father
 lose thy youth peace achieve
 silver livery advised age
 thy reverence thy chairdays thus
 die ruffian battle even sight
 heart turnd stone tis mine
 shall stony york old men spares
 babes tears virginal
 shall even dew fire
 beauty tyrant oft reclaims
 shall flaming wrath oil flax
 henceforth pity
 meet infant house york
 many gobbets cut

 scene ii york

 flourish enter king henry queen margaret prince wales
 clifford
 northumberland drum trumpets

 queen margaret welcome lord brave town york
 yonders head archenemy
 sought encompassd crown
 doth object cheer heart lord
 king henry ay rocks cheer fear wreck
 see sight irks soul
 withhold revenge dear god tis fault
 wittingly infringd vow
 clifford gracious liege much lenity
 harmful pity must laid aside
 lions cast gentle looks
 beast would usurp den
 whose hand forest bear doth lick
 spoils young face
 scapes lurking serpents mortal sting
 sets foot upon back
 smallest worm turn trodden
 doves peck safeguard brood
 ambitious york level thy crown
 thou smiling knit angry brows
 duke would son king
 raise issue like loving sire
 thou king blessd goodly son
 didst yield consent disinherit
 argued thee unloving father
 unreasonable creatures feed young
 though mans face fearful eyes
 yet protection tender ones
 hath seen even wings
 sometime usd fearful flight
 make war climbd unto nest
 offering lives youngs defence
 shame liege make precedent
 pity goodly boy
 lose birthright fathers fault
 long hereafter say unto child
 greatgrandfather grandsire got
 careless father fondly gave away
 ah shame look boy
 let manly face promiseth
 successful fortune steel thy melting heart
 hold thine leave thine
 king henry full well hath clifford playd orator
 inferring arguments mighty force
 clifford tell didst thou never hear
 things ill got ever bad success
 happy always son
 whose father hoarding went hell
 ill leave son virtuous deeds behind
 would father left
 rest held rate
 brings thousandfold care keep
 possession jot pleasure
 ah cousin york would thy best friends know
 doth grieve thy head
 queen margaret lord cheer spirits foes nigh
 soft courage makes followers faint
 promisd knighthood forward son
 unsheathe sword dub presently
 edward kneel
 king henry edward plantagenet arise knight
 learn lesson draw thy sword right

 scene v another part field

 scene iv plains wear tewksbury

 soldiers

 loss

 industry courage might savd
 ah shame ah fault

 montague topmast

 friends france shrouds tacklings
 though unskilful ned

 good chide waves speak fair

 make like spirit

 prologue

 come make laugh things
 bear weighty serious brow
 sad high working full state woe
 noble scenes draw eye flow
 present pity
 may think well let fall tear
 subject deserve give
 money hope may believe
 may find truth come see
 show two agree
 play may pass still willing
 ill undertake may see away shilling
 richly two short hours
 come hear merry bawdy play
 noise targets see fellow
 long motley coat guarded yellow
 deceivd gentle hearers know
 rank chosen truth show
 fool fight beside forfeiting
 brains opinion bring
 make true intend
 leave us never understanding friend
 therefore goodness sake known
 first happiest hearers town
 sad would make ye think ye see
 persons noble story
 living think see great
 followd general throng sweat
 thousand friends moment see
 soon mightiness meets misery
 merry ill say
 man may weep upon weddingday

 scene heath

 enter edgar

 like doth quit like measure still measure
 angelo thy faults thus manifested
 though thou wouldst deny denies thee vantage
 condemn thee block

 much wonder one man seeing much another man

 act


 scene london room palace

 enter king richard john gaunt nobles attendants

 old john gaunt timehonoured lancaster
 hast thou according thy oath band
 brought hither henry hereford thy bold son
 make good boist ’ rous late appeal
 leisure would let us hear
 duke norfolk thomas mowbray

 gaunt
 liege

 king richard
 tell moreover hast thou sounded
 appeal duke ancient malice
 worthily good subject
 known ground treachery

 gaunt
 near could sift argument
 apparent danger seen
 aimed highness inveterate malice

 call presence face face
 frowning brow brow hear
 accuser accused freely speak
 highstomached full ire

 act ii

 enforce attention like deep harmony
 words scarce seldom spent vain
 breathe truth breathe words pain
 must say listened
 youth ease taught glose

 though richard life ’ counsel would hear

 praises whose state wise fond
 lascivious metres whose venom sound

 report fashions proud italy
 whose manners still tardyapish nation
 limps base imitation

 new ’ respect vile—

 doth mutiny wit ’ regard
 direct whose way choose
 ’ tis breath thou lack ’ st breath wilt thou lose

 gaunt

 thus expiring foretell
 rash fierce blaze riot last

 small showers last long sudden storms short
 tires betimes spurs fast betimes
 eager feeding food doth choke feeder

 consuming means soon preys upon
 royal throne kings sceptered isle

 infection hand war
 happy breed men little world

 serves office wall
 moat defensive house
 envy less happier lands
 blessed plot earth realm england

 feared breed famous birth
 renowned deeds far home

 world ’ ransom blessed mary ’ son

 dear reputation world
 leased out—i die pronouncing it—
 like tenement pelting farm

 whose rocky shore beats back envious siege
 wat ’ ry neptune bound shame
 inky blots rotten parchment bonds

 hath made shameful conquest
 ah would scandal vanish life
 happy ensuing death

 act iv


 scene westminster hall

 lords spiritual right side throne lords
 temporal left commons enter bolingbroke aumerle
 surrey northumberland harry percy fitzwater another lord
 bishop carlisle abbot westminster attendants

 call forth bagot

 enter officers bagot


 bagot freely speak thy mind
 thou dost know noble gloucester ’ death
 wrought king performed
 bloody office timeless end

 bagot
 set face lord aumerle

 bolingbroke
 cousin stand forth look upon man

 bagot
 lord aumerle know daring tongue
 scorns unsay hath delivered
 dead time gloucester ’ death plotted
 heard say “ arm length
 reacheth restful english court
 far calais mine uncle ’ head ”
 amongst much talk time
 heard say rather refuse
 offer hundred thousand crowns
 bolingbroke ’ return england
 adding withal blest land would
 cousin ’ death

 aumerle
 princes noble lords
 answer shall make base man
 shall much dishonour fair stars
 equal terms give chastisement
 either must mine honour soiled
 attainder slanderous lips

 scene iii friar lawrence ’ cell

 enter friar lawrence basket

 friar lawrence
 ere sun advance burning eye
 day cheer night ’ dank dew dry
 must upfill osier cage
 baleful weeds preciousjuiced flowers
 earth ’ nature ’ mother tomb
 burying grave womb
 womb children divers kind
 sucking natural bosom find
 many many virtues excellent
 none yet different
 mickle powerful grace lies
 plants herbs stones true qualities
 naught vile earth doth live

 aught good strain ’ fair use
 revolts true birth stumbling abuse
 virtue turns vice misapplied
 vice sometime ’ action dignified

 within infant rind weak flower

 truly hearts eyes

 hath wash ’ thy sallow cheeks rosaline

 lo upon thy cheek stain doth sit

 laying paris monument

 oft men point death
 merry keepers call
 lightning death may
 call lightning love wife

 never palace dim night
 depart remain

 thy drugs quick thus kiss die

 act ii

 love

 act iii

 scene padua room baptista ’ house

 enter lucentio hortensio bianca

 lucentio

 soon forgot entertainment
 sister katherine welcome ’ withal

 hortensio
 wrangling pedant
 patroness heavenly harmony
 give leave prerogative
 music spent hour
 lecture shall leisure much

 preposterous ass never read far
 know cause music ordain ’
 refresh mind man
 studies usual pain
 give leave read philosophy
 pause serve harmony

 hortensio
 sirrah bear braves thine

 bianca
 gentlemen double wrong
 strive resteth choice
 breeching scholar schools
 ’ tied hours ’ pointed times
 learn lessons please
 cut strife sit
 take instrument play whiles
 lecture done ere tun ’

 hortensio
 ’ leave lecture tune

 retires

 lucentio
 never tune instrument

 bianca
 left last

 lucentio
 madam—
 hic ibat simois hic est sigeia tellus
 hic steterat priami regia celsa senis

 construe

 son unto vincentio pisa sigeia tellus disguised thus get
 love hic steterat lucentio comes awooing priami
 man tranio regia bearing port celsa senis
 might beguile old pantaloon

 madam instrument ’ tune

 let ’ hear—

 hortensio plays

 fie treble jars

 lucentio
 spit hole man tune

 bianca
 let see construe hic ibat simois know
 hic est sigeia tellus trust hic steterat priami take
 heed hear us regia presume celsa senis despair

 madam ’ tis tune

 lucentio
 base

 hortensio
 base right ’ tis base knave jars
 aside fiery forward pedant
 life knave doth court love
 pedascule ’ watch better yet

 bianca

 ajax call ’ grandfather

 bianca

 arguing still upon doubt
 let rest licio
 good master take unkindly pray
 thus pleasant

 lessons make music three parts

 lucentio
 formal sir well must wait
 aside watch withal deceiv ’
 fine musician groweth amorous

 hortensio
 madam touch instrument
 learn order fingering
 must begin rudiments art
 teach gamut briefer sort
 pleasant pithy effectual
 hath taught trade
 writing fairly drawn

 bianca
 past gamut long ago

 hortensio
 yet read gamut hortensio

 bianca
 gamut ground accord
 plead hortensio ’ passion
 b mi bianca take thy lord
 c fa ut loves affection
 sol one clef two notes
 e la mi show pity die
 call gamut tut like
 old fashions please best nice
 change true rules odd inventions

 yet thy thoughts bianca humble

 scene ii baptista ’ house

 enter baptista gremio tranio katherina bianca lucentio

 signior lucentio ’ pointed day
 katherine petruchio married
 yet hear soninlaw

 want bridegroom priest attends

 says lucentio shame

 katherina
 shame mine must forsooth forc ’
 give hand oppos ’ heart
 unto madbrain rudesby full spleen
 woo ’ haste means wed leisure
 told frantic fool
 hiding bitter jests blunt behaviour
 noted merry man
 ’ woo thousand ’ point day marriage
 make friends invite proclaim banns
 yet never means wed hath woo ’
 must world point poor katherine
 say ‘ lo mad petruchio ’ wife
 would please come marry ’

 tranio
 patience good katherine baptista
 upon life petruchio means well
 whatever fortune stays word
 though blunt know passing wise
 though merry yet withal ’ honest

 much shrew thy impatient humour

 master master news old news news never heard

 sir

 baptista

 coming

 petruchio coming new hat old jerkin pair old
 breeches thrice turned pair boots candlecases
 one buckled another laced old rusty sword ta ’ en town
 armoury broken hilt chapeless two broken points
 horse hipped old mothy saddle stirrups kindred
 besides possessed glanders like mose chine
 troubled lampass infected fashions full
 windgalls sped spavins rayed yellows past cure
 fives stark spoiled staggers begnawn bots swayed
 back shouldershotten nearlegged
 halfchecked bit headstall sheep ’ leather
 restrained keep stumbling hath often burst
 repaired knots one girth six times pieced woman ’ crupper
 velure hath two letters name fairly set
 studs pieced packthread

 comes

 linen stock one leg kersey boothose gartered

 prick ’ ’ feather monster monster apparel

 ’ see event

 exeunt baptista gremio attendants

 tranio
 sir love concerneth us add
 father ’ liking bring pass
 imparted worship
 get man—whate ’ er
 skills much ’ fit turn—
 shall vincentio pisa
 make assurance padua
 greater sums promised
 shall quietly enjoy hope
 marry sweet bianca consent

 perform ’ let world say
 ’ keep mine despite world

 degrees mean look
 watch vantage business

 signior gremio came church

 ’ devil devil fiend

 tut ’ lamb dove fool

 amaz ’ priest let fall book

 ‘ take ’ quoth ‘ list ’

 tranio
 said wench rose

 gremio
 trembled shook stamp ’ swore
 vicar meant cozen
 many ceremonies done
 calls wine ‘ health ’ quoth
 abroad carousing mates
 storm quaff ’ muscadel
 threw sops sexton ’ face
 reason
 beard grew thin hungerly
 seem ’ ask sops drinking
 done took bride neck
 kiss ’ lips clamorous smack
 parting church echo
 seeing came thence shame
 know rout coming
 mad marriage never
 hark hark hear minstrels play

 music plays

 enter petrucio katherina bianca baptista hortensio grumio
 train

 petruchio
 gentlemen friends thank pains
 know think dine today
 prepar ’ great store wedding cheer
 haste doth call hence
 therefore mean take leave

 baptista
 ’ possible away tonight

 petruchio
 must away today night come
 make wonder knew business
 would entreat rather go stay
 honest company thank
 beheld give away
 patient sweet virtuous wife
 dine father drink health
 must hence farewell

 tranio
 let us entreat stay till dinner

 petruchio
 may

 gremio
 let entreat

 petruchio


 katherina
 let entreat

 petruchio
 content

 katherina

 petruchio

 yet stay entreat

 katherina

 petruchio
 grumio horse

 grumio
 ay sir ready oats eaten horses

 katherina
 nay
 thou canst go today
 tomorrow till please
 door open sir lies way
 may jogging whiles boots green
 ’ gone till please
 ’ tis like ’ prove jolly surly groom
 take first roundly

 petruchio
 kate content thee prithee angry

 katherina

 father quiet shall stay leisure

 gremio
 ay marry sir begins work

 katherina
 gentlemen forward bridal dinner
 see woman may made fool
 spirit resist

 shall go forward kate thy command

 stands touch whoever dare

 ’ buckler thee million

 act iv

 scene hall petruchio ’ country house

 enter grumio

 grumio
 fie fie tired jades mad masters foul ways
 ever man beaten ever man ray ’ ever man weary
 sent make fire coming warm
 little pot soon hot lips might freeze
 teeth tongue roof mouth heart belly ere
 come fire thaw blowing fire shall
 warm considering weather taller man
 take cold holla ho curtis

 enter curtis

 curtis
 calls coldly

 piece ice thou doubt thou mayst slide shoulder
 heel greater run head neck fire good
 curtis

 curtis

 hot shrew ’ reported

 grumio

 mistress fellow curtis

 away threeinch fool beast

 least wilt thou make fire shall complain thee
 mistress whose hand—she hand— thou shalt soon feel
 thy cold comfort slow thy hot office

 prithee good grumio tell goes world

 grumio
 cold world curtis every office thine therefore fire
 thy duty thy duty master mistress almost
 frozen death

 ’ fire ready therefore good grumio news

 ’ tis hope end successfully
 falcon sharp passing empty

 never looks upon lure

 thy maintenance commits body
 painful labour sea land

 even woman oweth husband

 foul contending rebel

 asham ’ women simple
 offer war kneel peace
 seek rule supremacy sway
 bound serve love obey
 bodies soft weak smooth
 unapt toil trouble world
 soft conditions hearts
 well agree external parts
 come come froward unable worms
 mind hath big one
 heart great reason haply

 see lances straws
 strength weak weakness past compare

 vail stomachs boot

 hand ready may ease

 act iv

 scene prospero ’ cell

 enter prospero ferdinand miranda

 scene v senate house

 enter three senators one door alcibiades meeting
 attendants

 first senator lord voice tot faults bloody
 tis necessary die
 nothing emboldens sin much mercy
 second senator true law shall bruise
 alcibiades honour health compassion senate
 first senator captain
 alcibiades humble suitor virtues
 pity virtue law
 none tyrants use cruelly
 pleases time fortune lie heavy
 upon friend mine hot blood
 hath steppd law past depth
 without heed plunge intot
 man setting fate aside
 comely virtues
 soil fact cowardice
 honour buys fault
 noble fury fair spirit
 seeing reputation touchd death
 oppose foe
 sober unnoted passion
 behove anger ere twas spent
 provd argument
 first senator undergo strict paradox
 striving make ugly deed look fair
 words took pains labourd
 bring manslaughter form set
 quarrelling upon head valour indeed
 valour misbegot came world
 sects factions newly born
 hes truly valiant wisely suffer
 worst man breathe
 make wrongs outsides
 wear like raiment carelessly
 neer prefer injuries heart
 bring danger
 wrongs evils enforce us kill
 folly tis hazard life ill
 alcibiades lord
 first senator make gross sins look clear
 revenge valour bear
 alcibiades lords favour pardon
 speak like captain
 fond men expose battle
 endure threats sleep upont
 let foes quietly cut throats
 without repugnancy
 valour bearing make
 abroad women valiant
 stay home bearing carry
 ass captain lion fellow
 loaden irons wiser judge
 wisdom suffering lords
 great pitifully good
 condemn rashness cold blood
 kill grant sins extremest gust
 defence mercy tis

 man angry
 weigh crime

 alcibiades vain service done
 lacedaemon byzantium
 sufficient briber life
 first senator whats

 drowns takes valour prisoner

 overcome beastly fury
 known commit outrages
 cherish factions tis inferrd us

 first senator dies

 lords parts
 though right arm might purchase time
 debt none yet move
 take deserts join em

 security ill pawn victories

 law strict war nothing

 height displeasure friend brother

 makes senate ugly

 enter chiron demetrius

 demetrius dear sovereign gracious mother
 doth highness look pale wan
 tamora reason think look pale
 two ticed hither place
 barren detested vale see
 trees though summer yet forlorn lean
 overcome moss baleful mistletoe
 never shines sun nothing breeds
 unless nightly owl fatal raven
 showd abhorred pit
 told dead time night
 thousand fiends thousand hissing snakes
 ten thousand swelling toads many urchins
 would make fearful confused cries
 mortal body hearing
 straight fall mad else die suddenly
 sooner told hellish tale
 straight told would bind
 unto body dismal yew
 leave miserable death
 calld foul adulteress
 lascivious goth bitterest terms
 ever ear hear effect
 wondrous fortune come
 vengeance executed
 revenge love mothers life
 ye henceforth calld children

 stabs bassianus
 chiron struck home show strength
 also stabs
 lavinia ay come semiramis nay barbarous tamora
 name fits thy nature thy
 tamora give poniard shall know boys
 mothers hand shall right mothers wrong
 demetrius stay madam belongs
 first thrash corn burn straw
 minion stood upon chastity
 upon nuptial vow loyalty
 painted hope braves mightiness
 shall carry unto grave
 chiron would eunuch
 drag hence husband secret hole
 make dead trunk pillow lust
 tamora ye honey desire
 let wasp outlive us sting
 chiron warrant madam make sure
 come mistress perforce enjoy
 nicepreserved honesty
 lavinia tamora thou bearest womans face
 tamora hear speak away
 lavinia sweet lords entreat hear word
 demetrius listen fair madam let glory
 see tears heart
 unrelenting flint drops rain
 lavinia tigers young ones teach dam
 learn wrath taught thee
 milk thou suckdst turn marble
 even thy teat thou hadst thy tyranny
 yet every mother breeds sons alike
 chiron thou entreat show womans pity
 chiron wouldst thou prove bastard
 lavinia tis true raven doth hatch lark
 yet heard could find
 lion movd pity endure
 princely paws pard away
 say ravens foster forlorn children
 whilst birds famish nests
 though thy hard heart say
 nothing kind something pitiful
 tamora know means away
 lavinia let teach thee fathers sake
 gave thee life well might slain thee
 obdurate open thy deaf ears
 tamora hadst thou person neer offended
 even sake pitiless
 remember boys pourd forth tears vain
 save brother sacrifice
 fierce andronicus would relent
 therefore away use
 worse better lovd
 lavinia tamora calld gentle queen
 thine hands kill place
 tis life beggd long
 poor slain bassianus died
 tamora begst thou fond woman let go
 lavinia tis present death beg one thing
 womanhood denies tongue tell
 keep worse killing lust
 tumble loathsome pit
 never mans eye may behold body
 charitable murderer
 tamora rob sweet sons fee
 let satisfy lust thee

 blot enemy general name

 reenter aaron two
 titus sons quintus martius

 aaron come lords better foot
 straight bring loathsome pit
 espied panther fast asleep
 quintus sight dull whateer bodes
 martius mine promise shame
 well could leave sport sleep awhile
 falls pit
 quintus art thou fallen subtle hole
 whose mouth covered rudegrowing briers
 upon whose leaves drops newshed blood
 fresh morning dew distilld flowers
 fatal place seems
 speak brother hast thou hurt thee fall
 martius brother dismalst object hurt
 ever eye sight made heart lament
 aaron aside fetch king find
 thereby may likely guess
 made away brother exit
 martius dost comfort help
 unhallowd bloodstained hole
 quintus surprised uncouth fear
 chilling sweat oerruns trembling joints
 heart suspects mine eye see
 martius prove thou hast true divining heart
 aaron thou look den
 see fearful sight blood death
 quintus aaron gone compassionate heart
 permit mine eyes behold
 thing whereat trembles surmise
 tell neer till
 child fear know
 martius lord bassianus lies berayd blood
 heap like slaughtered lamb
 detested dark blooddrinking pit
 quintus dark dost thou know tis
 martius upon bloody finger doth wear
 precious ring lightens hole
 like taper monument
 doth shine upon dead mans earthy cheeks
 shows ragged entrails pit
 pale shine moon pyramus
 night lay bathd maiden blood
 brother help thy fainting hand
 fear hath made thee faint hath
 fell devouring receptacle
 hateful cocytus misty mouth

 wanting strength thee much good
 may pluckd swallowing womb
 deep pit poor bassianus grave

 marcus niece flies away fast
 cousin word husband
 dream would wealth would wake
 wake planet strike
 may slumber eternal sleep
 speak gentle niece stern ungentle hands
 hath loppd hewd made thy body bare
 two branches sweet ornaments
 whose circling shadows kings sought sleep
 might gain great happiness
 half thy love dost speak
 alas crimson river warm blood
 like bubbling fountain stirrd wind
 doth rise fall thy rosed lips
 coming going thy honey breath
 sure tereus hath deflowered thee
 lest thou shouldst detect cut thy tongue
 ah thou turnst away thy face shame
 notwithstanding loss blood
 conduit three issuing spouts
 yet thy cheeks look red titans face
 blushing encountred cloud
 shall speak thee shall say tis
 knew thy heart knew beast
 might rail ease mind

 doth burn heart cinders

 tedious sampler sewd mind

 monster seen lily hands

 act iii scene rome street

 enter judges tribunes senators titus two sons martius

 titus going pleading

 pity mine age whose youth spent
 dangerous wars whilst securely slept

 filling aged wrinkles cheeks
 pitiful condemned sons
 whose souls corrupted tis thought
 two twenty sons never wept
 died honours lofty bed

 pass prisoners exeunt
 tribunes dust write
 hearts deep languor souls sad tears

 sons sweet blood make shame blush

 thou refuse drink dear sons blood

 hath hurt killd dead

 scene iii rome public place

 enter titus bearing arrows letters ends
 marcus young lucius gentlemen publius sempronius
 caius bows

 titus come marcus come kinsmen way
 sir boy let see archery
 look ye draw home enough tis straight
 terras astrea reliquit
 remembred marcus shes gone shes fled
 sirs take tools cousins shall
 go sound ocean cast nets
 happily may catch sea
 yet theres little justice land
 publius sempronius must
 tis must dig mattock spade
 pierce inmost centre earth
 come plutos region
 pray deliver petition
 tell justice aid
 comes old andronicus
 shaken sorrows ungrateful rome
 ah rome well well made thee miserable
 time threw peoples suffrages
 thus doth tyrannize oer
 go get gone pray careful
 leave manofwar unsearchd
 wicked emperor may shippd hence
 kinsmen may go pipe justice
 marcus publius heavy case
 see thy noble uncle thus distract
 publius therefore lords highly us concerns
 day night attend carefully
 feed humour kindly may
 till time beget careful remedy
 marcus kinsmen sorrows past remedy
 join goths revengeful war
 take wreak rome ingratitude
 vengeance traitor saturnine
 titus publius masters
 met
 publius good lord pluto sends word
 revenge hell shall
 marry justice employd
 thinks jove heaven somewhere else
 perforce must needs stay time
 titus doth wrong feed delays
 ill dive burning lake
 pull acheron heels
 marcus shrubs cedars
 bigbond men framd cyclops size

 prologue

 troy lies scene isles greece
 princes orgulous high blood chaf ’
 port athens sent ships
 fraught ministers instruments
 cruel war sixty nine wore
 crownets regal athenian bay
 put forth toward phrygia vow made
 ransack troy within whose strong immures
 ravish ’ helen menelaus ’ queen
 wanton paris sleeps—and ’ quarrel
 tenedos come
 deepdrawing barks disgorge
 warlike fraughtage dardan plains
 fresh yet unbruised greeks pitch
 brave pavilions priam ’ sixgated city
 dardan tymbria ilias chetas troien
 antenorides massy staples
 corresponsive fulfilling bolts
 stir sons troy
 expectation tickling skittish spirits
 one side trojan greek
 sets hazard hither come
 prologue arm ’ confidence
 author ’ pen actor ’ voice suited
 like conditions argument
 tell fair beholders play
 leaps ’ er vaunt firstlings broils
 beginning middle starting thence away
 may digested play
 like find fault pleasures
 good bad ’ tis chance war

 scene ii troy priam ’ palace

 many hours lives speeches spent
 thus says nestor greeks
 ‘ deliver helen damage else—

 hector
 though man lesser fears greeks
 far toucheth particular
 yet dread priam
 lady softer bowels
 spongy suck sense fear
 ready cry ‘ knows follows ’
 hector wound peace surety

 beacon wise tent searches
 th ’ bottom worst let helen go
 since first sword drawn question
 every tithe soul ’ mongst many thousand dismes
 hath dear helen—i mean

 yielding

 fie fie brother
 weigh worth honour king

 pastproportion infinite

 fears reasons fie godly shame

 helenus

 empty father

 dreams slumbers brother priest
 fur gloves reason reasons
 know enemy intends harm

 reason flies object harm
 marvels helenus beholds

 wings reason heels

 like star disorb ’ nay talk reason
 let ’ shut gates sleep manhood honour

 make service greater god
 dotes attributive
 infectiously affects
 without image th ’ affected merit

 troilus
 take today wife election
 led conduct
 enkindled mine eyes ears
 two traded pilots ’ twixt dangerous shores
 judgement may avoid
 although distaste elected
 wife chose evasion
 blench stand firm honour
 turn back silks upon merchant
 soil ’ remainder viands
 throw unrespective sieve
 full thought meet
 paris vengeance greeks
 breath full consent bellied sails
 seas winds old wranglers took truce
 service touch ’ ports desir ’
 old aunt greeks held captive
 brought grecian queen whose youth freshness
 wrinkles apollo ’ makes stale morning
 keep grecians keep aunt
 worth keeping pearl
 whose price hath launch ’ thousand ships
 turn ’ crown ’ kings merchants
 ’ avouch ’ twas wisdom paris went—
 must needs cried ‘ go go ’ —
 ’ confess brought home worthy prize—
 must needs clapp ’ hands
 cried ‘ inestimable ’ —why
 issue proper wisdoms rate
 deed never fortune did—
 beggar estimation priz ’
 richer sea land theft base
 stol ’ n fear keep
 thieves unworthy thing stol ’ n

 envious calumniating time

 scene iii silvias window

 enter eglamour

 eglamour hour madam silvia
 entreated call know mind
 theres great matter shed employ
 madam madam

 enter silvia window

 silvia calls
 eglamour servant friend
 one attends ladyships command
 silvia sir eglamour thousand times good morrow
 eglamour many worthy lady
 according ladyships impose
 thus early come know service
 pleasure command
 silvia eglamour thou art gentleman
 think flatter swear
 valiant wise remorseful well accomplishd
 thou art ignorant dear good
 bear unto banishd valentine
 father would enforce marry
 vain thurio soul abhors
 thyself hast lovd heard thee say
 grief ever come near thy heart
 thy lady thy true love died
 upon whose grave thou vowdst pure chastity
 sir eglamour would valentine
 mantua hear makes abode
 ways dangerous pass
 desire thy worthy company
 upon whose faith honour repose
 urge fathers anger eglamour
 think upon grief ladys grief
 justice flying hence
 keep unholy match
 heaven fortune still rewards plagues
 desire thee even heart
 full sorrows sea sands
 bear company go
 hide said thee
 may venture depart alone
 eglamour madam pity much grievances
 since know virtuously placd
 give consent go along
 recking little betideth
 much wish good befortune
 go
 silvia evening coming
 eglamour shall meet
 silvia friar patricks cell
 intend holy confession
 eglamour fail ladyship good morrow gentle lady
 silvia good morrow kind sir eglamour exeunt

 scene iv silvias window

 enter launce dog

 launce mans servant shall play cur look
 goes hard one brought puppy one savd
 drowning three four blind brothers sisters went
 taught even one would say precisely thus
 would teach dog sent deliver present
 mistress silvia master came sooner
 diningchamber steps trencher steals
 capons leg tis foul thing cur keep
 companies would one say one takes upon
 dog indeed dog things
 wit take fault upon
 think verily hangd fort sure live
 sufferd fort shall judge thrusts
 company three four gentlemanlike dogs dukes table
 bless mark pissing
 chamber smelt dog says one cur
 says another whip says third hang says
 duke acquainted smell knew
 crab goes fellow whips dogs friend quoth
 mean whip dog ay marry quoth
 wrong quoth twas thing wot makes
 ado whips chamber many masters
 would servant nay ill sworn sat
 stock puddings hath stoln otherwise executed
 stood pillory geese hath killd otherwise
 sufferd fort thou thinkst nay remember
 trick servd took leave madam silvia
 bid thee still mark didst thou see heave
 leg make water gentlewomans farthingale didst
 thou ever see trick

 enter proteus julia boys clothes

 proteus sebastian thy name like thee well
 employ thee service presently
 julia please ill
 proteusi hope thou wilt launce whoreson
 peasant
 two days loitering
 launce marry sir carried mistress silvia dog bade
 proteus says little jewel
 launce marry says dog cur tells currish
 thanks good enough present
 proteus receivd dog
 launce indeed brought back

 proteus didst thou offer
 launce ay sir squirrel stoln
 hangmans boys marketplace offerd mine
 dog big ten therefore gift
 greater
 proteus go get thee hence find dog
 neer return sight
 away say stayest thou vex exit launce
 slave still end turns shame
 sebastian entertained thee
 partly need youth
 discretion business
 tis trusting yond foolish lout
 chiefly thy face thy behaviour
 augury deceive
 witness good bringing fortune truth
 therefore know thou entertain thee
 go presently take ring thee
 deliver madam silvia
 lovd well deliverd
 julia seems lovd leave token
 dead belike
 proteus think lives
 julia alas
 proteus dost thou cry alas
 julia choose
 pity
 proteus wherefore shouldst thou pity
 julia methinks lovd well
 love lady silvia
 dreams forgot love
 dote cares love
 tis pity love contrary
 thinking makes cry alas
 proteus well give ring therewithal
 letter thats chamber tell lady
 claim promise heavenly picture
 message done hie home unto chamber
 thou shalt find sad solitary exit proteus
 julia many women would message
 alas poor proteus thou hast entertaind
 fox shepherd thy lambs
 alas poor fool pity
 heart despiseth
 loves despiseth
 love must pity
 ring gave parted
 bind remember good
 unhappy messenger
 plead would obtain
 carry would refusd
 praise faith would dispraisd
 masters true confirmed love
 true servant master
 unless prove false traitor
 yet woo yet coldly
 heaven knows would speed

 enter silvia attended

 gentlewoman good day pray mean
 bring speak madam silvia
 silvia would
 julia entreat patience
 hear speak message sent
 silvia
 julia master sir proteus madam
 silvia sends picture
 julia ay madam
 silvia ursula bring picture
 go give master tell
 one julia changing thoughts forget
 would better fit chamber shadow
 julia madam please peruse letter
 pardon madam unadvisd
 deliverd paper
 letter ladyship
 silvia pray thee let look
 julia may good madam pardon
 silvia hold
 look upon masters lines
 know stuffd protestations
 full newfound oaths wul break
 easily tear paper
 julia madam sends ladyship ring
 silvia shame sends
 heard say thousand times
 julia gave departure
 though false finger profand ring
 mine shall julia much wrong
 julia thanks
 silvia sayst thou
 julia thank madam tender
 poor gentlewoman master wrongs much
 silvia dost thou know
 julia almost well know
 think upon woes protest
 wept hundred several times
 silvia belike thinks proteus hath forsook
 julia think doth thats cause sorrow
 silvia passing fair
 julia hath fairer madam
 think master lovd well
 judgment fair
 since neglect lookingglass
 threw sunexpelling mask away
 air hath starvd roses cheeks
 pinchd lilytincture face
 become black
 silvia tall
 julia stature pentecost
 pageants delight playd
 youth got play womans part
 trimmd madam julias gown
 served fit mens judgments
 garment made
 therefore know height
 time made weep good
 play lamentable part
 madam twas ariadne passioning
 theseus perjury unjust flight
 lively acted tears
 poor mistress moved therewithal
 wept bitterly would might dead
 thought felt sorrow
 silvia beholding thee gentle youth
 alas poor lady desolate left
 weep think upon thy words
 youth purse give thee
 thy sweet mistress sake thou lovst
 farewell exit silvia attendants
 julia shall thank fort eer know
 virtuous gentlewoman mild beautiful
 hope masters suit cold
 since respects mistress love much
 alas love trifle
 picture let see think
 tire face mine
 full lovely
 yet painter flatterd little
 unless flatter much
 hair auburn mine perfect yellow
 difference love
 ill get colourd periwig
 eyes grey glass mine
 ay foreheads low mines high
 respects
 make respective
 fond love blinded god
 come shadow come take shadow
 tis thy rival thou senseless form
 thou shalt worshippd kissd lovd adord
 sense idolatry
 substance statue thy stead
 ill use thee kindly thy mistress sake
 usd else jove vow
 scratchd unseeing eyes
 make master love thee exit

 act v scene milan abbey

 enter eglamour

 eglamour sun begins gild western sky
 hour
 silvia friar patricks cell meet
 fail lovers break hours
 unless come time
 much spur expedition

 enter silvia

 see comes lady happy evening
 silvia amen amen go good eglamour
 postern abbey wall
 fear attended spies
 eglamour fear forest three leagues
 recover sure enough exeunt

 scene ii milan dukes palace

 enter thurio proteus julia sebastian

 thurio sir proteus says silvia suit
 proteus sir find milder
 yet takes exceptions person
 thurio leg long
 proteus little
 thurio ill wear boot make somewhat rounder
 julia aside love spurrd loathes
 thurio says face
 proteus says fair one
 thurio nay wanton lies face black
 proteus pearls fair old saying
 black men pearls beauteous ladies eyes
 julia aside tis true pearls put ladies eyes
 rather wink look
 thurio likes discourse
 proteus ill talk war
 thurio well discourse love peace
 julia aside better indeed hold peace
 thurio says valour
 proteus sir makes doubt
 julia aside needs knows cowardice
 thurio says birth
 proteus well derivd
 julia aside true gentleman fool
 thurio considers possessions
 proteus ay pities
 thurio wherefore
 julia aside ass owe
 proteus lease
 julia comes duke

 enter duke

 duke sir proteus thurio
 saw sir eglamour late
 thurio
 proteus
 duke saw daughter
 proteus neither
 duke
 shes fled unto peasant valentine
 eglamour company
 tis true friar lawrence met
 penance wanderd forest
 knew well guessd
 maskd sure
 besides intend confession
 patricks cell even
 likelihoods confirm flight hence
 therefore pray stand discourse
 mount presently meet
 upon rising mountain foot
 leads toward mantua whither fled
 dispatch sweet gentlemen follow exit
 thurio peevish girl
 flies fortune follows
 ill revengd eglamour
 love reckless silvia exit
 proteus follow silvias love
 hate eglamour goes exit
 julia follow cross love
 hate silvia gone love exit

 scene iii frontiers mantua forest

 enter outlaws silva

 first outlaw come come
 patient must bring captain
 silvia thousand mischances one
 learnd brook patiently
 second outlaw come bring away
 first outlaw gentleman
 second outlaw nimblefooted hath outrun us
 moyses valerius follow
 go thou west end wood
 captain well follow thats fled
 thicket beset scape
 first outlaw come must bring captains cave
 fear bears honourable mind
 use woman lawlessly
 silvia valentine endure thee exeunt

 scene iv another part forest

 enter valentine

 valentine use doth breed habit man
 shadowy desert unfrequented woods
 better brook flourishing peopled towns
 sit alone unseen
 nightingales complaining notes
 tune distresses record woes
 thou dost inhabit breast
 leave mansion long tenantless
 lest growing ruinous building fall
 leave memory
 repair thy presence silvia
 thou gentle nymph cherish thy forlorn swain
 halloing stir today
 mates make wills law
 unhappy passenger chase
 love well yet much
 keep uncivil outrages
 withdraw thee valentine whos comes
 steps aside

 enter proteus silvia julia sebastian

 proteus madam service done
 though respect aught servant doth
 hazard life rescue
 would forcd honour love
 vouchsafe meed one fair look
 smaller boon beg
 less sure give
 valentine aside like dream see hear
 love lend patience forbear awhile
 silvia miserable unhappy
 proteus unhappy madam ere came
 coming made happy
 silvia thy approach thou makst unhappy
 julia aside approacheth presence
 silvia seized hungry lion
 would breakfast beast
 rather false proteus rescue
 heaven judge love valentine
 whose lifes tender soul
 full much
 detest false perjurd proteus
 therefore gone solicit
 proteus dangerous action stood next death
 would undergo one calm look
 tis curse love still approvd
 women love theyre belovd
 silvia proteus love hes belovd
 read julias heart thy first best love
 whose dear sake thou didst rend thy faith
 thousand oaths oaths
 descended perjury love
 thou hast faith left unless thoudst two
 thats far worse none better none
 plural faith much one
 thou counterfeit thy true friend
 proteus love
 respects friend
 silvia men proteus
 proteus nay gentle spirit moving words
 way change milder form
 ill woo like soldier arms end
 love gainst nature love force ye
 silvia heaven
 proteus ill force thee yield desire
 valentine ruffian let go rude uncivil touch
 thou friend ill fashion
 proteus valentine
 valentine thou common friend thats without faith love
 friend treacherous man
 thou hast beguild hopes nought mine eye
 could persuaded dare say
 one friend alive thou wouldst disprove
 trusted ones right hand
 perjured bosom proteus
 sorry must never trust thee
 count world stranger thy sake
 private wound deepest time accurst
 mongst foes friend worst
 proteus shame guilt confounds
 forgive valentine hearty sorrow
 sufficient ransom offence
 tender truly suffer
 eer commit
 valentine paid
 receive thee honest
 repentance satisfied
 heaven earth pleasd
 penitence th eternals wraths appeasd
 love may appear plain free
 mine silvia give thee
 julia unhappy swoons
 proteus look boy
 valentine boy wag
 whats matter look speak
 julia good sir master chargd deliver ring madam
 silvia neglect never done
 proteus ring boy
 julia tis
 proteus let see ring gave julia
 julia cry mercy sir mistook
 ring sent silvia
 proteus camst thou ring
 depart gave unto julia
 julia julia give
 julia brought hither
 proteus julia
 julia behold gave aim thy oaths
 entertaind em deeply heart
 oft hast thou perjury cleft root
 proteus let habit make thee blush
 thou ashamd took upon
 immodest raiment shame live
 disguise love
 lesser blot modesty finds
 women change shapes men minds
 proteus men minds tis true heaven man
 constant perfect one error
 fills faults makes run th sins
 inconstancy falls ere begins
 silvias face may spy
 fresh julias constant eye
 valentine come come hand either
 let blest make happy close
 twere pity two friends long foes
 proteus bear witness heaven wish ever
 julia mine

 enter outlaws duke thurio

 outlaw prize prize prize
 valentine forbear forbear say lord duke
 grace welcome man disgracd
 banished valentine
 duke sir valentine
 thurio yonder silvia silvias mine
 valentine thurio give back else embrace thy death
 come within measure wrath
 name silvia thine
 verona shall hold thee stands
 take possession touch
 dare thee breathe upon love
 thurio sir valentine care
 hold fool endanger
 body girl loves
 claim therefore thine
 duke degenerate base art thou
 make means thou hast done
 leave slight conditions
 honour ancestry
 applaud thy spirit valentine
 think thee worthy empress love
 know forget former griefs
 cancel grudge repeal thee home
 plead new state thy unrivalld merit
 thus subscribe sir valentine
 thou art gentleman well derivd
 take thou thy silvia thou hast deservd
 valentine thank grace gift hath made happy
 beseech daughters sake
 grant one boon shall ask
 duke grant thine whateer
 valentine banishd men kept withal
 men endud worthy qualities
 forgive committed
 let recalld exile
 reformed civil full good
 fit great employment worthy lord
 duke thou hast prevaild pardon thee
 dispose thou knowst deserts
 come let us go include jars
 triumphs mirth rare solemnity
 valentine walk along dare bold
 discourse make grace smile
 think page lord
 duke think boy hath grace blushes
 valentine warrant lord grace boy
 duke mean saying
 valentine please ill tell pass along
 wonder hath fortuned
 come proteus tis penance hear
 story loves discovered
 done day marriage shall
 one feast one house one mutual happiness exeunt
