 taborer
 gerrold schoolmaster

 prologue

 florish

 new playes maydenheads neare kin
 much followd much mony gyn
 stand sound well good play
 whose modest sceanes blush marriage day
 shake loose honour like hir
 holy tye first nights stir
 yet still modestie still retaines
 maid sight husbands paines
 pray play may sure
 noble breeder pure
 learned poet never went
 famous yet twixt po silver trent
 chaucer admird story gives
 constant eternity lives
 let fall noblenesse
 first sound child heare hisse
 shake bones good man
 make cry ground fan
 witles chaffe wrighter
 blastes bayes famd workes makes lighter
 robin hood feare bring
 say truth endlesse thing
 ambitious aspire
 weake almost breathlesse swim
 deepe water hold
 helping hands shall take
 something doe save us shall heare
 sceanes though art may yet appeare
 worth two houres travell bones sweet sleepe
 content play doe keepe
 little dull time us perceave
 losses fall thicke must needs leave florish

 act

 scene athens temple

 enter hymen torch burning boy white robe
 singing strewing flowres hymen nimph encompast

 tresses bearing wheaten garland theseus betweene
 two nimphs wheaten chaplets heades
 hipolita bride lead pirithous another holding
 garland head tresses likewise hanging
 emilia holding traine artesius attendants

 song musike

 roses sharpe spines gon
 royall smels alone
 hew
 maiden pinckes odour faint
 dazies smellesse yet quaint
 sweet time true

 primrose first borne child ver
 merry spring times herbinger
 bels dimme
 oxlips cradles growing
 marygolds death beds blowing
 larkesheeles trymme

 deere natures children sweete
 ly fore bride bridegroomes feete strew flowers
 blessing sence
 angle aire
 bird melodious bird faire
 absent hence

 crow slaundrous cuckoe
 boding raven chough hore
 chattring pie
 may bridehouse pearch sing
 discord bring
 fly

 enter queenes blacke vailes staind imperiall
 crownes queene fals downe foote theseus
 fals downe foote hypolita emilia

 queen
 pitties sake true gentilities
 heare respect

 queen
 mothers sake
 wish womb may thrive faire ones
 heare respect

 queen
 love iove hath markd
 honour bed sake
 cleere virginity advocate
 us distresses good deede
 shall raze oth booke trespasses
 set downe

 theseus
 sad lady rise

 hippolita
 stand

 emilia
 knees
 woman may steed distrest
 bind

 theseus
 whats request deliver

 queen
 queenes whose soveraignes fel
 wrath cruell creon endured
 beakes ravens tallents kights
 pecks crowes fowle feilds thebs
 suffer us burne bones
 urne ashes take th offence
 mortall loathsomenes blest eye
 holy phoebus infects windes
 stench slaine lords pitty duke
 thou purger earth draw thy feard sword
 good turnes toth world give us bones
 dead kings may chappell
 thy boundles goodnes take note
 crowned heades roofe
 save lyons beares
 vault every thing

 theseus
 pray kneele
 transported speech sufferd
 knees wrong heard fortunes
 dead lords gives lamenting
 wakes vengeance revenge forem
 king capaneus lord day
 marry season
 met groome
 marsis altar time faire
 iunos mantle fairer tresses
 bounty spread wheaten wreathe
 threashd blasted fortune
 dimpled cheeke smiles hercules kinesman
 weaker eies laide club
 tumbled downe upon nemean hide
 swore sinews thawd greife time
 fearefull consumers devoure

 queen
 hope god
 god hath put mercy manhood
 whereto heel infuse powre presse forth
 undertaker

 theseus
 knees none widdow
 vnto helmeted belona use
 pray souldier
 troubled turnes away

 queen
 honoured hypolita
 dreaded amazonian hast slaine
 sithtuskd bore thy arme strong
 white wast neere make male
 thy sex captive thy lord
 borne uphold creation honour
 first nature stilde shrunke thee
 bownd thou wast oreflowing subduing
 thy force thy affection soldiresse
 equally canst poize sternenes pitty
 know hast much power
 ever thee owst strength
 love servant
 tenour thy speech deere glasse ladies
 bid flaming war doth scortch
 vnder shaddow sword may coole us
 require advance ore heades
 speakt womans key like woman
 us three weepe ere faile
 lend us knee
 touch ground us longer time
 doves motion heads pluckt
 tell ith blood cizd field lay swolne
 showing sun teeth grinning moone
 would doe

 hippolita
 poore lady say
 leife trace good action
 whereto going never yet
 went willing way lord taken
 hart deepe distresse let consider
 ile speake anon

 queen
 petition kneele emilia
 set downe yce hot greefe uncandied
 melts drops sorrow wanting forme
 prest deeper matter

 emilia
 pray stand
 greefe written cheeke

 queen
 woe
 reade teares—
 like wrinckled peobles glassie streame
 may behold em lady lady alacke
 treasure know oth earth
 must know center fish
 least minnow let lead line
 catch one heart pardon
 extremity sharpens sundry wits
 makes foole

 emilia
 pray say nothing pray
 feele see raine int
 knowes neither wet dry
 groundpeece painter would buy
 tinstruct gainst capitall greefe indeed—
 heart peircd demonstration alas
 naturall sifter sex
 sorrow beates ardently upon
 shall make counter reflect gainst
 brothers heart warme pitty
 though made stone pray good comfort

 theseus
 forward toth temple leave iot
 oth sacred ceremony

 queen
 celebration
 long last costly
 suppliants war remember fame
 knowles eare oth world doe quickly
 done rashly first thought
 others laboured meditance premeditating
 actions oh iove actions
 soone mooves asprayes doe fish
 subdue touch thinke deere duke thinke
 beds slaine kings

 queen
 greifes beds
 deere lords none

 queen
 none fit th dead
 cordes knives drams precipitance
 weary worlds light
 beene deathes horrid agents humaine grace
 affords dust shaddow

 queen
 lords
 ly blistring fore visitating sunne
 good kings living

 theseus
 true give comfort
 give dead lords graves doe
 must make worke creon

 queen
 worke presents selfe toth
 twill take forme heates gone morrow
 booteles toyle must recompence selfe
 owne sweat hes secure
 dreames stand puissance
 wrinching holy begging eyes
 make petition cleere

 queen
 may take drunke victory

 queen
 army full bread sloth

 theseus
 artesius best knowest
 draw fit enterprise
 primst proceeding number
 carry businesse forth levy
 worthiest instruments whilst despatch
 grand act life daring deede
 fate wedlocke

 queen
 dowagers take hands
 let us widdowes woes delay
 commends us famishing hope


 farewell

 queen
 come unseasonably could greefe
 cull forth unpanged judgement fitst time
 best solicitation

 theseus
 good ladies
 service whereto going
 greater imports
 actions foregone
 futurely cope

 queen
 proclaiming
 suit shall neglected armes
 able locke iove synod shall
 warranting moonelight corslet thee oh
 twyning cherries shall sweetnes fall
 vpon thy tastefull lips wilt thou thinke
 rotten kings blubberd queenes care
 thou feelst thou feelst able
 make mars spurne drom thou couch
 one night every howre int
 take hostage thee hundred
 thou shalt remember nothing
 banket bids thee

 hippolita
 though much unlike kneeling
 transported much sorry
 suitour yet thinke
 thabstayning joy
 breeds deeper longing cure surfeit
 craves present medcine plucke
 ladies scandall therefore sir
 shall make tryall prayres
 either presuming force
 sentencing ay vigour dombe
 prorogue busines going hang
 sheild afore heart necke
 ffee freely lend
 doe poore queenes service

 queens
 oh helpe
 cause cries knee

 emilia
 grant kneeling
 sister petition force
 celerity nature
 shee makes henceforth ile dare
 aske thing hardy
 ever take husband

 theseus
 pray stand
 entreating selfe doe
 kneele pyrithous
 leade bride get pray gods
 successe returne omit thing
 pretended celebration queenes
 follow soldier hence artesius
 banckes aulis meete us
 forces raise shall finde
 moytie number busines
 bigger lookt since theame haste
 stamp kisse upon thy currant lippe
 sweete keepe token set forward
 see gone exeunt towards temple
 farewell beauteous sister pyrithous
 keepe feast full bate howre ont

 perithous
 sir
 ile follow heeles feasts solempnity
 shall want till returne

 theseus
 cosen charge
 boudge athens shall returning
 ere end feast pray
 make abatement farewell

 queen
 thus dost thou still make good tongue oth world

 queen
 earnst deity equal mars

 queen

 thou mortall makest affections bend
 godlike honours say
 grone mastry

 theseus
 men
 thus doe sensually subdude
 loose humane tytle good cheere ladies florish
 turne towards comforts exeunt

 scene thebs

 enter palamon arcite

 arcite
 deere palamon deerer love blood
 prime cosen yet unhardned
 crimes nature let us leave citty
 thebs temptings int
 sully glosse youth
 keepe abstinence shame
 incontinence swim
 ith aide oth current almost sincke
 least frustrate striving follow
 common streame twold bring us edy
 turne drowne labour
 gaine life weakenes

 palamon
 advice
 cride example strange ruins
 since first went schoole may perceive
 walking thebs skars bare weedes
 gaine oth martialist propound
 bold ends honour golden ingots
 though flurted
 peace fought shall offer
 marsis scornd altar doe bleede
 meete wish great iuno would
 resume ancient fit ielouzie
 get soldier worke peace might purge
 repletion retaine anew
 charitable heart hard harsher
 strife war could

 arcite

 meete ruine soldier
 cranckes turnes thebs begin
 met decaies many kindes
 perceive none doe arowse pitty
 thunconsiderd soldier

 palamon
 yes pitty
 decaies ere finde
 sweating honourable toyle
 paide yce coole em

 arcite
 tis
 begin speake vertue
 respect thebs spake thebs
 dangerous keepe honours
 resyding every evill
 hath good cullor every seeming goods
 certaine evill evn iumpe
 strangers
 things meere monsters

 palamon
 tis power
 vnlesse feare apes tutors
 masters manners neede
 affect anothers gate catching
 faith fond upon
 anothers way speech mine owne
 may reasonably conceivd savd
 speaking truly bound
 generous bond follow
 followes taylor haply long untill
 followd make pursuit let know
 mine owne barber unblest
 poore chinne tis cizard iust
 favorites glasse cannon
 command rapier hip
 danglet hand go tip toe
 streete foule either
 forehorse teame none
 draw ith sequent trace poore sleight sores
 neede plantin rips bosome
 almost toth hearts—

 arcite
 vncle creon

 palamon

 unbounded tyrant whose successes
 makes heaven unfeard villany assured
 beyond power theres nothing almost puts
 faith feavour deifies alone
 voluble chance onely attributes
 faculties instruments
 owne nerves act commands men service
 winne int boot glory one
 feares harm good dares let
 blood mine thats sibbe suckt
 leeches let breake fall
 corruption

 arcite
 cleere spirited cozen
 lets leave court may nothing share
 lowd infamy milke
 relish pasture must
 vile disobedient kinesmen
 blood unlesse quality

 palamon
 nothing truer
 thinke ecchoes shames deaft
 eares heavnly iustice widdows cryes
 descend againe throates

 enter valerius

 due audience gods—valerius

 valerius
 king cals yet leaden footed
 till great rage phebus
 broke whipstocke exclaimd
 horses sun whisperd
 lowdenesse fury

 palamon
 small windes shake
 whats matter

 valerius
 theseus threates appals hath sent
 deadly defyance pronounces
 ruine thebs hand seale
 promise wrath

 arcite
 let approach
 feare gods brings
 jot terrour us yet man
 thirds owne worth case
 actions dregd minde assurd
 tis bad goes

 palamon
 leave unreasond
 services stand thebs creon
 yet neutrall dishonour
 rebellious oppose therefore must
 stand mercy fate
 hath bounded last minute

 arcite
 must
 ist sed warres foote shall
 faile condition

 valerius
 tis motion
 intelligence state came instant
 defier

 palamon
 lets king
 quarter carrier honour
 enemy come blood venture
 health spent
 rather laide purchase alas
 hands advancd hearts
 fall oth stroke doe damage

 arcite
 let thevent
 never erring arbitratour tell us
 know selves let us follow
 becking chance exeunt

 scene gates athens

 enter pirithous hipolita emilia

 perithous


 hippolita
 sir farewell repeat wishes
 great lord whose succes dare
 make timerous question yet wish
 exces overflow power andt might
 dure illdealing fortune speede
 store never hurtes good gouernours

 perithous
 though know
 ocean needes poore drops yet
 must yeild tribute precious maide
 best affections heavens infuse
 best temperd peices keepe enthroand
 deare heart

 emilia
 thanckes sir remember
 royall brother whose speede
 great bellona ile sollicite
 since terrene state petitions
 without giftes understood ile offer
 shall advised likes hearts
 army tent

 hippolita
 ins bosome
 bin soldiers wee weepe
 friends helmes put sea
 tell babes broachd launce women

 theseus
 like men use em
 lees millions rates
 exceede wine others surgions
 convent behoofe richest balmes
 rather niggard waft lives concerne us
 much thebs worth rather em
 freed plight morning state
 sound liberty would em dead
 forty thousand fold rather em
 prisoners us death beare em speedily
 kinde aire unkinde minister
 man man may doe—for sake
 since knowne frights fury friends beheastes
 loves provocations zeale mistris taske
 desire liberty feavour madnes
 hath set marke nature could reach
 without imposition sicknes

 palamon
 cosen arcite
 thebs noble country
 friends kindreds never
 must behold comforts never see
 hardy youthes strive games honour
 hung painted favours ladies
 like tall ships saile start amongst em
 eastwind leave en behinde us
 like lazy clowdes whilst palamon arcite
 even wagging wanton leg
 outstript peoples praises garlands
 ere time wish em never
 shall two exercise like twyns honour
 armes againe feele fyry horses
 like proud seas us good swords
 better redeyd god war nevr wore
 ravishd sides like age must run rust
 decke temples gods hate us
 hands shall never drawem like lightning
 blast whole armies

 arcite
 palamon
 hopes prisoners us
 graces youthes must wither
 like tootimely spring age must finde us
 heaviest palamon unmarried
 sweete embraces loving wife
 loden kisses armd thousand cupids
 shall never claspe neckes issue know us
 figures selves shall evr see
 glad age like young eagles teach em
 boldly gaze bright armes say
 remember fathers conquer
 faireeyd maides shall weepe banishments
 songs curse everblinded fortune
 till shee shame see wrong done
 youth nature world
 shall know nothing one another
 heare nothing clocke tels woes
 vine shall grow shall never see
 sommer shall come delights
 deadcold winter must inhabite still

 palamon
 tis true arcite theban houndes
 shooke aged forrest ecchoes
 must halloa shake
 pointed iavelyns whilst angry swine
 flyes like parthian quiver rages
 strucke wellsteeld darts valiant uses
 foode nourishment noble mindes
 us two shall perish shall die
 curse honour lastly
 children greife ignorance

 arcite

 even bottom miseries
 fortune inflict upon us
 see two comforts rysing two meere blessings
 gods please hold brave patience
 enjoying greefes together
 whilst palamon let perish
 thinke prison

 certeinly

 men hate much

 scene prison

 enter iaylors daughter alone

 daughter
 let dukes divells rore
 liberty venturd
 brought little wood
 mile hence sent cedar
 higher rest spreads like plane
 fast brooke shall keepe close
 till provide fyles foode yet
 yron bracelets love
 stout hearted child thou art father
 durst better indurd cold yron done
 love beyond love beyond reason
 wit safetie made know
 care desperate law
 finde condemne fort wenches
 honest harted maides sing dirge
 tell memory death noble
 dying almost martyr way takes
 purpose way sure
 unmanly leave
 doe maides easily
 trust men againe yet thankd
 done much kist
 thinkes well scarcely
 could perswade become freeman
 made scruples wrong
 father yet hope
 considers love mine
 take root within let doe
 use kindly
 use shall ile proclaime
 face man ile presently
 provide necessaries packe cloathes
 patch ground ile venture
 hee like shadow
 ile ever dwell within houre whoobub
 ore prison
 kissing man looke farewell father
 get many prisoners daughters
 shortly may keepe selfe

 act iii

 scene forest near athens

 cornets sundry places noise hallowing people
 maying

 enter arcite alone

 arcite
 duke lost hypolita tooke
 severall land solemne right
 owe bloomd may athenians pay
 toth heart ceremony queene emilia
 fresher may sweeter
 hir gold buttons bowes
 thenamelld knackes oth meade garden yea
 challenge bancke nymph
 makes streame seeme flowers thou iewell
 oth wood oth world hast likewise blest place
 thy sole presence thy rumination
 poore man might eftsoones come betweene
 chop cold thought thrice blessed chance
 drop mistris expectation
 giltlesse ont tell lady fortune
 next emely soveraigne far
 may prowd takes strong note
 hath made neere beuteous morne
 primst yeare presents
 brace horses two steeds might well
 paire kings backt field
 crownes titles tride alas alas
 poore cosen palamon poore prisoner thou
 little dreamst upon fortune
 thou thinkst thy selfe happier thing
 neare emilia thou deemst thebs
 therein wretched although free
 thou knewst mistris breathd
 eard language livde eye coz
 passion would enclose thee

 enter palamon bush shackles bends fist
 arcite

 palamon
 traytor kinesman
 thou shouldst perceive passion signes
 prisonment hand
 owner sword othes one
 iustice love would make thee
 confest traytor thou perfidious
 ever gently lookd voydest honour
 eur bore gentle token falsest cosen
 ever blood made kin callst thou hir thine
 ile prove shackles hands
 void appointment thou lyst art
 theefe love chaffy lord
 worth name villaine sword
 house clogges away—

 arcite
 deere cosin palamon—

 palamon
 cosoner arcite give language
 thou hast shewd feate

 arcite
 finding
 circuit breast grosse stuffe
 forme like blazon holds
 gentlenesse answer tis passion
 thus mistakes enemy
 kind honor honestie
 cherish depend evr
 skip faire coz
 ile maintaine proceedings pray pleasd
 shew generous termes griefes since
 questions equall professes
 cleare owne way minde sword
 true gentleman

 palamon
 thou durst arcite

 arcite
 coz coz beene well advertisd
 much dare yave seene use sword
 thadvice feare sure another
 would heare doubted silence
 breake though ith sanctuary

 palamon
 sir
 seene move place well
 might justifie manhood calld
 good knight bold whole weekes faire
 day rayne valiant temper
 men loose encline trecherie
 fight like coupelld beares would fly
 tyde

 arcite
 kinsman might well
 speake act glasse
 eare disdaines

 palamon
 come
 quit cold gyves give sword
 though rustie charity
 one meale lend come
 good sword thy hand doe say
 emily thine forgive
 trespasse thou hast done yea life
 thou carryt brave soules shades
 dyde manly seeke
 newes earth shall get none
 thou art brave noble

 arcite
 content
 againe betake hawthorne house
 counsaile night
 wholesome viands impediments
 file shall garments
 perfumes kill smell oth prison
 shall stretch selfe say arcite
 plight shall choyce
 sword armour

 palamon
 oh heavens dares
 noble beare guilty busines none
 onely arcite therefore none arcite
 kinde bold

 arcite
 sweete palamon

 palamon
 doe embrace offer—for
 offer doot onely sir person
 without hipocrisy may wish winde hornes cornets
 swords edge ont

 arcite
 heare hornes
 enter musite least match betweens
 crost er met give hand farewell
 ile bring every needfull thing pray
 take comfort strong

 palamon
 pray hold promise
 doe deede bent brow certaine
 love rough powre
 oile language ayre
 could word give cuffe stomach
 reconcild reason

 arcite
 plainely spoken
 yet pardon hard language spur winde hornes
 horse chide content anger
 one face harke sir call
 scatterd banket must guesse
 office

 palamon
 sir attendance
 please heaven know office
 vnjustly atcheevd

 arcite
 good title
 perswaded question sicke betweens
 bleeding must curd suitour
 sword bequeath plea
 talke

 palamon
 one word
 going gaze upon mistris
 note mine is—

 arcite
 nay

 palamon
 nay pray
 talke feeding breed strength
 going looke upon sun
 strengthens lookes
 vantage ore enjoyt till
 may enforce remedy farewell exeunt

 scene another part forest

 enter iaylors daughter alone

 daughter
 mistooke brake meant gone
 fancy tis welnigh morning
 matter would perpetuall night
 darkenes lord oth world harke tis woolfe
 hath greife slaine feare one thing
 care nothing thats palamon
 wreake wolves would jaw
 file hallowd
 hallow whoopd
 answeard call wolfe
 doe service heard
 strange howles livelong night mayt
 made prey weapons
 run iengling gives
 might call fell things listen
 sence know man unarmd
 smell resistance ile set downe
 hes torne peeces howld many together
 fed much
 bold ring bell stand
 alls chard gone lye
 fathers hangd escape
 selfe beg prizd life much
 deny act would
 try death dussons—i mopt
 food tooke none two daies
 sipt water closd mine eyes
 save lids scowrd brine alas
 dissolue life let sence unsettle
 least drowne stab hang selfe
 state nature faile together
 since thy best props warpt way
 best way next way grave
 errant step beside torment loe
 moone cryckets chirpe schreichowle
 calls dawne offices done
 save faile point
 end exit

 scene scene

 scene another part forest

 enter iaylors daughter

 daughter
 cold stars
 little stars looke like aglets
 sun seene folly palamon
 alas hees heaven
 yonders sea thers ship howt tumbles
 thers rocke lies watching water
 beates upon
 thers leak sprung sound one cry
 spoon winde youl loose els
 vp course two take boyes
 good night good night yar gone—i hungry
 would could finde fine frog would tell
 newes parts oth world would make
 carecke cockle shell sayle
 east north east king pigmes
 tels fortunes rarely father
 twenty one trust trice
 morrow morning ile say never word

 sing

 ile cut greene coat foote knee ile clip
 yellow lockes inch mine eie hey nonny nonny nonny hes
 buy white cut forth ride ile goe seeke throw
 world wide hey nonny nonny nonny

 pricke like nightingale
 put breast shall sleepe like top else
 exit

 scene another part forest

 enter schoole master countrymen bavian wenches
 taborer

 schoolmaster
 fy fy tediosity disensanity among ye
 rudiments bin labourd long ye milkd unto ye figure
 even plumbroth marrow understanding laid upon ye
 still cry wherfore course freeze
 capacities ye jane iudgements saide thus let
 let let man understand mee proh deum medius
 fidius ye dunces stand duke comes
 close thicket duke appeares meete
 unto utter learned things many figures heares nods
 hums cries rare goe forward length fling
 cap marke meleager bore
 break comly like true lovers cast selves
 body decently sweetly figure trace turne boyes

 countreyman
 sweetly doe master gerrold

 countreyman
 draw company wheres taborour

 countreyman
 timothy

 schoolmaster

 theseus
 cold beginning

 schoolmaster
 favour country pastime made
 collected
 ruder tongues distinguish villager
 say veritie fable
 merry rout else rable
 company figure choris
 fore thy dignitie dance morris
 rectifier
 title pedagogus let fall
 birch upon breeches small ones
 humble ferula tall ones
 doe present machine frame
 daintie duke whose doughtie dismall fame
 dis dedalus post pillar
 blowne abroad helpe thy poore well willer
 thy twinckling eyes looke right straight
 vpon mighty morr—of mickle waight
 comes glewd together
 makes morris cause came hether
 body sport small study
 first appeare though rude raw muddy
 speake thy noble grace tenner
 whose great feete offer penner
 next lord may lady bright
 chambermaid servingman night
 seeke silent hanging mine host
 fat spowse welcomes cost
 gauled traveller beckning
 informes tapster inflame reckning
 beast eating clowne next foole
 bavian long tayle eke long toole
 cum multis alijs make dance
 say shall presently advance

 intrate filij come forth foot it—

 scene scene iii

 enter palamon bush

 palamon
 houre cosen gave faith
 visit againe bring
 two swords two good armors faile
 hes neither man souldier left
 thinke weeke could restord
 lost strength growne low
 crestfalne wants thanke thee arcite
 thou art yet faire foe feele selfe
 refreshing able againe
 dure danger delay longer
 would make world think comes hearing
 lay fatting like swine fight
 souldier therefore blest morning
 shall last sword refuses
 hold kill tis iustice
 love fortune me—o good morrow

 enter arcite armors swords

 arcite
 good morrow noble kinesman

 palamon
 put much paines sir

 arcite
 much faire cosen
 debt honour duty

 palamon
 would sir could wish ye
 kinde kinsman force finde
 beneficiall foe embraces
 might thanke ye blowes

 arcite
 shall thinke either well done
 noble recompence

 palamon
 shall quit

 arcite
 defy faire termes show
 mistris anger
 love thing thats honourable
 bred talke man armd
 upon guards let fury
 like meeting two tides fly strongly us
 birthright beauty
 truely pertaines without obbraidings scornes
 dispisings persons powtings
 fitter girles schooleboyes seene
 quickly mine wilt please arme sir
 feele selfe fitting yet
 furnishd old strength ile stay cosen
 evry day discourse health
 spard person friends
 could wish saide lovd
 though dide loving lady
 justifying love must fly fromt

 palamon
 arcite thou art brave enemy
 man thy cosens fit kill thee
 well lusty choose armes

 arcite
 choose sir

 palamon
 wilt thou exceede dost thou doe
 make spare thee

 arcite
 thinke cosen
 deceived soldier
 spare

 palamon
 thats well said

 arcite
 youl finde

 palamon
 honest man love
 justice affection
 ile pay thee soundly ile take

 arcite
 thats mine
 ile arme first

 palamon
 pray thee tell cosen
 gotst thou good armour

 arcite
 tis dukes
 say true stole doe pinch

 palamon
 noe

 arcite
 ist heavie

 palamon
 worne lighter
 shall make serve

 arcite
 ile bucklt close

 palamon
 meanes

 arcite
 care grand guard

 palamon

 would faine fight

 arcite
 indifferent

 palamon

 far enough

 arcite
 warrant

 palamon
 caske

 arcite

 palamon
 shall nimbler

 arcite

 prethee take mine good cosen

 palamon

 doe looke falne much away

 palamon

 arcite
 doe spare
 ile give cause sweet cosen

 palamon
 sir
 thinkes armors like arcite
 thou worst day kings fell lighter

 well remember outdid cosen
 never saw valour chargd
 vpon left wing enemie
 spurd hard come
 right good horse

 palamon
 indeede bright bay remember

 could wishes reach yet little

 modest cosen

 peece streight

 palamon

 palamon

 palamon

 hornes within stand

 palamon

 duke hunting told
 found wretched retire
 honours sake safety presently
 bush agen sir shall finde
 many howres dye gentle cosen
 seene perish instantly
 breaking prison reveale
 contempt world scorne us
 say noble difference
 base disposers

 palamon

 hidden put

 know cunning know cause
 faints shame take put thy selfe
 vpon thy present guard—

 mad

 thy life

 enter theseus hipolita emilia perithous traine

 theseus
 ignorant mad malicious traitors
 gainst tenor lawes
 making battaile thus like knights appointed
 without leave officers armes
 castor shall dye

 palamon
 hold thy word theseus
 certainly traitors despisers
 thee thy goodnesse palamon
 love thee broke thy prison
 thinke well deserves arcite
 bolder traytor never trod thy ground
 falser neur seemd friend man
 begd banishd contemnes thee
 thou darst doe disguise
 thy owne edict followes thy sister
 fortunate bright star faire emilia
 whose servant right seeing
 first bequeathing soule justly
 dares thinke
 treacherie like trusty lover
 calld answer thou beest
 thou art spoken great vertuous
 true descider injuries
 say fight againe thou shalt see theseus
 doe iustice thou thy selfe wilt envie
 take life ile wooe thee toot

 perithous
 heaven
 man

 theseus
 sworne

 arcite
 seeke
 thy breath mercy theseus tis
 thing soone dye thee say
 movd man calls traitor
 let say thus much love treason
 service excellent beutie
 love faith perish
 brought life confirme
 servd truest worthiest
 dare kill cosen denies
 let traitor ye please
 scorning thy edict duke aske lady
 faire eyes command
 stay love say traytor
 villaine fit lye unburied

 palamon
 thou shalt pitty us theseus
 unto neither thou shew mercy stop
 thou art thy noble eare us
 thou art valiant thy cosens soule
 whose strong labours crowne memory
 lets die together one instant duke
 onely little let fall
 may tell soule shall

 theseus
 grant wish say true cosen
 ten times offended gave
 mercy found sir offenses
 none speake em
 ere sun set shall sleepe ever

 speake denide face
 beare curses else ages
 lost cosens

 finde anger em ruyn

 powers women us

 almost men yet yeelded theseus

 theseus
 ye make faith reele say felt
 compassion toem would place

 emilia

 theseus
 right woman sister pitty
 want vnderstanding use
 desire lives invent way
 safer banishment two live
 agony love em
 kill one another every day
 theyld fight howrely bring honour
 publique question swords wise
 forget em concernes credit
 oth equally said die
 better fall byth law one another
 bow honor

 emilia

 oth rashly made anger

 stand expresse world must perish
 beside another oth gainst

 made passion neither good heede

 sister

 vrge home brave lady

 emilia
 would nevr deny thing
 fit modest suit free granting
 tye word ye fall int
 thinke maime honour
 set begging sir deafe
 compassion lives
 might breed ruine name opinion
 shall thing loves perish
 cruell wisedome doe men proyne
 straight yong bowes blush thousand blossoms
 may rotten duke theseus
 goodly mothers groand
 longing maides ever lovd
 vow stand shall curse beauty
 funerall songs two cosens

 heavens sake save lives banish em

 conditions

 great lake lies behind pallace

 pretty soule

 weel daunce antique fore duke
 beg pardon talkd sir
 must loose head morrow morning
 must gather flowers bury
 see house made handsome sung
 nothing willow willow willow betweene
 ever palamon faire palamon
 palamon tall yong man place
 knee deepe sat careles tresses
 wreathe bullrush rounded stucke

 feedes lake waters iris

 scene room palace

 enter emilia alone pictures

 emilia
 yet may binde wounds must open
 bleed death sake else ile choose
 end strife two yong hansom men
 shall never fall weeping mothers
 following dead cold ashes sonnes
 shall never curse cruelty good heaven
 sweet face arcite wise nature
 best endowments beuties
 sowes birthes noble bodies
 mortall woman
 coy denialls yong maydes yet doubtles
 would run mad man eye
 fyry sparkle quick sweetnes
 yong prince love himselfe sits smyling
 iust another wanton ganimead
 set jove fire enforcd god
 snatch goodly boy set
 shining constellation brow
 spacious majesty carries
 archd like great eyd iunos far sweeter
 smoother pelops shoulder fame honour
 thinks hence promontory
 pointed heaven clap wings sing
 world loves fights
 gods men neere em palamon
 foyle meere dull shadow
 hees swarth meagre eye heavy
 lost mother still temper
 stirring alacrity
 sprightly sharpenes smile
 yet count errours may become
 narcissus sad boy heavenly—
 oh finde bent womans fancy
 foole reason lost
 choice lyd lewdly
 women ought beate knees
 aske thy pardon palamon thou art alone
 beutifull eyes
 bright lamps beauty command
 threaten love yong mayd dare crosse em
 bold gravity yet inviting
 browne manly face love
 howre complexion lye arcite
 thou art changling meere gipsey
 noble bodie sotted
 vtterly lost virgins faith fled
 brother even askd
 whether lovd run mad arcite
 sister palamon
 stand together come aske brother—
 alas know aske sweet sister—
 may goe looke meere child fancie
 two faire gawdes equall sweetnesse
 distinguish must crie

 enter gentleman

 gentleman

 madam bring newes knights come

 gentleman
 yes

 emilia

 sinnes committed chast diana
 unspotted youth must soyld
 blood princes chastitie
 made altar lives lovers
 two greater two better never yet
 made mothers joy must sacrifice
 unhappy beautie

 theseus

 seene

 messenger
 sir
 truly thinke six braver spirits
 brought judge outside
 never saw read stands
 first place arcite seeming
 stout man face prince
 lookes say complexion
 nearer browne blacke sterne yet noble
 shewes hardy fearelesse proud dangers
 circles eyes show fire within
 heated lyon lookes
 haire hangs long behind blacke shining
 like ravens wings shoulders broad strong
 armd long round thigh sword
 hung curious bauldricke frownes
 seale better omy conscience
 never souldiers friend

 theseus
 thou hast well describde

 perithous
 yet great deale short
 thinkes thats first palamon

 theseus
 pray speake friend

 perithous
 ghesse prince
 may greater show
 ornament honour int
 hees somewhat bigger knight spoke
 face far sweeter complexion
 ripe grape ruddy felt
 without doubt fights apter
 make cause owne ins face appeares
 faire hopes undertakes
 hes angry setled valour
 tainted extreames runs body
 guides arme brave things feare
 shewes soft temper heads yellow
 hard hayrd curld thicke twind like ivy tods
 undoe thunder face
 liverie warlike maide appeares
 pure red white yet beard blest
 rowling eyes sits victory
 ever ment court valour
 nose stands high character honour
 red lips fights fit ladies

 emilia
 must men die

 perithous
 speakes tongue
 sounds like trumpet lyneaments
 man would wish em strong cleane
 weares wellsteeld axe staffe gold
 age five twenty

 messenger
 thers another
 little man tough soule seeming
 great fairer promises
 body yet never lookd

 perithous
 thats freckle facd

 messenger
 lord
 sweet ones

 perithous
 yes well

 messenger
 thinkes
 well disposd show
 great fine art nature hes white haird
 wanton white manly colour
 next aborne tough nimble set
 showes active soule armes brawny
 linde strong sinewes shoulder peece
 gently swell like women new conceavd
 speakes prone labour never fainting
 vnder waight armes stout harted still
 stirs tiger hes gray eyd
 yeelds compassion conquers sharpe
 spy advantages finds em
 hes swift make em dos wrongs
 takes none hes round facd smiles
 showes lover frownes souldier
 head weares winners oke
 stucke favour lady
 age six thirtie hand
 beares charging staffe embost silver

 theseus
 thus

 sonnes honour

 theseus

 enter iailor wooer doctor

 doctor
 distraction time moone


 iailor

 altogether without appetite save often drinking dreaming another
 world better broken peece matter soere shes

 withall fyts every question—

 looke shee comes shall perceive behaviour

 doctor
 intemprat surfeit eye hath distemperd sences
 may returne settle againe execute preordaind
 faculties extravagant vagary
 must doe confine place light may rather seeme
 steale permitted take vpon yong sir friend
 name palamon say come eate commune love
 catch attention minde beates upon
 objects inserted tweene minde eye become prankes
 friskins madnes sing greene songs love
 sayes palamon hath sung prison come stucke sweet
 flowers season mistres thereto make addition
 som compounded odours grateful sence
 shall become palamon palamon sing palamon sweet

 still among intermingle petition grace acceptance

 playpheeres let repaire palamon

 glasse running finish

 ought strove show
 mine enemy businesse wert one eye

 would destroy thoffender coz would
 though parcell selfe gather
 tender

 arcite
 labour
 push name auncient love kindred
 memory ith selfe place
 seate something would confound hoyst
 sayles must vessells port even
 heavenly lymiter pleases

 turne let embrace thee cosen

 palamon
 let farewell coz exeunt palamon
 knights

 arcite
 farewell sir—
 knights kinsemen lovers yea sacrifices
 true worshippers mars whose spirit
 expells seedes feare thapprehension
 still farther goe
 god profession
 require hearts lyons
 breath tigers yea fearcenesse
 yea speed also—to goe meane
 else wish snayles know prize
 must dragd blood force great feate
 must put garland stickes
 queene flowers intercession
 must makes campe cestron
 brymd blood men give aide
 bend spirits towards kneele
 thou mighty one thy power hast turnd
 greene neptune purple whose approach
 comets prewarne whose havocke vaste feild
 vnearthed skulls proclaime whose breath blowes downe
 teeming ceres foyzon doth plucke
 hand armypotent forth blew clowdes
 masond turrets makst breakst
 stony girthes citties thy puple
 yongest follower thy drom instruct day
 military skill thy lawde
 may advance streamer thee
 stild lord oth day give great mars
 token thy pleasure

 fall faces formerly heard
 clanging armor short thunder burst
 battaile
 whereupon rise bow altar

 great corrector enormous times
 shaker orerank states thou grand decider
 dustie old tytles healst blood
 earth sicke curst world
 oth pluresie people doe take
 thy signes auspiciously thy name
 designe march boldly let us goe exeunt

 enter palamon knights former observance

 palamon
 stars must glister new fire
 daie extinct argument love
 goddesse grant gives
 victory blend spirits mine
 whose free noblenesse doe make cause
 personall hazard goddesse venus
 commend proceeding implore
 power unto partie kneele formerly
 haile soveraigne queene secrets hast power
 call feircest tyrant rage
 weepe unto girle hast might
 even eyglance choke marsis drom
 turne thallarme whispers canst make
 criple florish crutch cure
 apollo mayst force king
 subjects vassaile induce
 stale gravitie daunce pould bachelour—
 whose youth like wonton boyes bonfyres
 skipt thy flame—at seaventy thou canst catch
 make scorne hoarse throate
 abuse yong laies love godlike power
 hast thou power upon phoebus thou
 addst flames hotter heavenly fyres
 scortch mortall son thine huntresse
 moyst cold say began throw
 bow away sigh take thy grace
 thy vowd souldier doe beare thy yoke
 twer wreath roses yet heavier
 lead selfe stings nettles
 never beene foule mouthd thy law
 nevr reveald secret knew none—would
 kend never practised
 vpon mans wife would libells reade
 liberall wits never great feastes
 sought betray beautie blushd
 simpring sirs beene harsh
 large confessors hotly askd
 mothers one woman
 women twer wrongd knew man
 eightie winters told
 lasse foureteene brided twas thy power
 put life dust aged crampe
 screwd square foote round
 gout knit fingers knots
 torturing convulsions globie eyes
 almost drawne spheeres life
 seemd torture anatomie
 yong faire pheare boy
 beleevd swore
 would beleeve briefe
 prate done companion
 boast defyer
 would rejoycer
 yea doe love tells close offices
 fowlest way names concealements
 boldest language one
 vow lover never yet made sigh
 truer soft sweet goddesse
 give victory question
 true loves merit blesse signe
 thy great pleasure

 musicke heard doves seene flutter fall
 againe upon faces knees

 palamon
 thou eleven ninetie raignst
 mortall bosomes whose chase world
 heards thy game give thee thankes
 faire token layd unto
 mine innocent true heart armes assurance bow
 body businesse let us rise
 bow goddesse time comes exeunt

 still musicke records

 enter emilia white haire shoulders wearing
 wheaten wreath one white holding traine haire stucke
 flowers one carrying silver hynde
 conveyd incense sweet odours set upon altar
 diana maides standing loofe sets fire
 curtsey kneele

 emilia
 sacred shadowie cold constant queene
 abandoner revells mute contemplative
 sweet solitary white chaste pure
 windefand snow thy femall knights
 alowst blood make blush
 orders robe heere thy priest
 humbled fore thine altar vouchsafe
 thy rare greene eye never yet
 beheld thing maculate looke thy virgin
 sacred silver mistris lend thine eare
 nevr heard scurrill terme whose port
 nere entred wanton found petition
 seasond holy feare last
 vestall office bride habited
 mayden harted husband pointed
 doe know two
 choose one pray successe
 guiltlesse election mine eyes
 loose one equall precious
 could doombe neither perishd
 goe toot unsentencd therefore modest queene
 two pretenders best loves
 truest title int let
 take wheaten gerland else grant
 fyle qualitie hold may
 continue thy band

 hynde vanishes altar place ascends
 rose tree one rose upon

 see generall ebbs flowes
 bowells holy altar
 sacred act advances one rose
 well inspird battaile shal confound
 brave knights virgin flowre
 must grow alone unpluckd

 heard sodaine twang instruments rose fals
 tree vanishes altar

 flowre falne tree descends mistris
 thou dischargest shall gatherd
 thinke know thine owne
 vnclaspe thy misterie—i hope shes pleasd
 signes gratious curtsey exeunt

 rather see wren hawke fly
 decision evry blow falls
 threats brave life stroake laments

 bell blade stay
 enough hearing shall punishd
 shall happen—gainst
 deaffing heare—not taint mine eye
 dread sights may shun

 sister

 exeunt theseus hipolita perithous c

 emilia
 arcite gently visagd yet eye
 like engyn bent sharpe weapon
 soft sheath mercy manly courage
 bedfellowes visage palamon
 menacing aspect brow
 gravd seemes bury frownes
 yet sometime tis alters
 quallity thoughts long time eye
 dwell upon object mellencholly
 becomes nobly dos arcites mirth
 palamons sadnes kinde mirth
 mingled mirth make sad
 sadnes merry darker humours
 sticke misbecomingly others
 live faire dwelling cornets trompets sound
 charge
 harke yon spurs spirit doe incite
 princes proofe arcite may win
 yet may palamon wound arcite
 spoyling figure pitty
 enough chance
 might doe hurt would glance eies
 toward seat motion might
 omit ward forfeit offence
 cravd time much better
 oh better never borne
 minister harme cornets great cry noice within
 crying palamon chance

 enter servant

 servant
 cries palamon

 emilia
 twas ever likely
 lookd grace successe
 doubtlesse primst men prethee run
 tell goes showt cornets crying
 palamon

 servant
 still palamon

 emilia
 run enquire poore servant thou hast lost
 vpon right side still wore thy picture
 palamons left know
 end int else chance would
 sinister side heart lyes palamon
 best boding chance another cry showt within
 cornets burst clamour
 sure thend oth combat

 enter servant

 servant
 saide palamon arcites body
 within inch oth pyramid cry
 generall palamon anon
 thassistants made brave redemption
 two bold tytlers instant
 hand hand

 worth composd man single share
 noblenes peculier gives
 prejudice disparity values shortnes cornets cry within

 palamon still

 enter theseus hipolita pirithous arcite victor
 attendants c

 theseus
 lo sister expectation
 yet quaking unsetled—fairest emily
 gods divine arbitrament
 given knight good one
 ever strooke head give hands
 receive plighted
 love growes decay

 arcite
 emily
 buy lost whats deerest
 save bought yet purchase cheapely
 doe rate value

 theseus
 loved sister
 speakes brave knight ere
 spur noble steed surely gods
 would die batchelour least race
 shew ith world godlike behaviour
 charmed thought alcides
 sow lead could praise
 part toth spoke arcite
 loose byt thus good
 encountred yet better heard
 two emulous philomels beate eare oth night
 contentious throates one higher
 anon againe first
 breasted sence
 could judge betweene em fard
 good space betweene kinesmen till heavens
 make hardly one winner weare girlond
 joy subdude
 give present iustice since know
 lives pinch em let done
 sceanes seeing goe hence
 right joyfull sorrow—arme prize
 know loose her—hipolita
 see one eye conceives teare
 deliver florish

 emilia
 wynning
 oh heavenly powers mercy
 wils saide must
 charge live comfort unfriended
 miserable prince cuts away
 life worthy women
 would die

 hippolita
 infinite pitty
 fowre eies fixd one
 two must needes blinde fort

 theseus
 exeunt

 scene block prepared

 enter palamon knightes pyniond iaylor executioner c
 gard

 palamon
 thers many man alive hath livd
 love oth people yea ith selfesame state
 stands many father childe comfort
 considering expire
 without mens pitty live still
 good wishes prevent
 loathsome misery age beguile
 gowt rheume lag howres attend
 grey approachers come towards gods
 yong unwapperd halting crymes
 many stale sure shall please gods
 sooner give us nectar em
 cleare spirits deare kinesmen
 whose lives poore comfort laid downe
 sould em cheape

 knight
 ending could
 content ore us victors
 fortune whose title momentary
 us death certaine graine honour
 oreweigh us

 knight
 let us bid farewell
 patience anger tottring fortune
 certainst reeles

 knight
 come begins

 palamon
 evn led banket shall
 taste all—ah ha friend friend
 gentle daughter gave freedome
 youl seet done ever pray
 heard well kind ill
 gave sorrow

 iailor
 sir shes well restord
 marryed shortly

 palamon
 short life
 glad ont tis latest thing
 shall glad prethee tell
 commend peece portion
 tender gives purse

 knight
 nay lets offerers

 knight
 maide

 palamon
 verily thinke
 right good creature deserving
 quight speake

 knights

 iailor

 make thankefull

 enter hast messenger

 messenger

 enter pirithous haste

 perithous
 hold hoa cursed hast made
 done quickly noble palamon
 gods shew glory life
 thou art yet leade

 palamon

 venus said false doe things fare

 perithous
 arise great sir give tydings eare
 dearly sweet bitter

 palamon

 hath wakt us dreame

 perithous
 list cosen
 mounted upon steed emily
 first bestow blacke one owing
 hayre worth white—which say
 weakens price many buy
 goodnesse note superstition
 heere findes allowance—on horse arcite
 trotting stones athens calkins
 rather tell trample horse
 would make length mile ift pleasd rider
 put pride thus went counting
 flinty pavement dancing twer toth musicke
 owne hoofes made say iron
 came musickes origen envious flint
 cold old saturne like possest
 fire malevolent darted sparke
 feirce sulphur else end made
 comment not—the hot horse hot fire
 tooke toy fell disorder
 power could give bounds comes end
 forgets schoole dooing therein traind
 kind mannadge piglike whines
 sharpe rowell freats rather
 jot obaies seekes foule meanes
 boystrous rough iadrie disseate
 lord kept bravely nought servd
 neither curb would cracke girth breake diffring plunges
 disroote rider whence grew
 kept tweene legges hind hoofes end stands
 arcites leggs higher head
 seemd strange art hand victors wreath
 even fell head presently
 backeward iade comes ore full poyze
 becomes riders loade yet living
 vessell tis floates
 surge next approaches much desires
 speech loe appeares

 enter theseus hipolita emilia arcite chaire

 palamon
 miserable end alliance
 gods mightie arcite thy heart
 thy worthie manly heart yet unbroken
 give thy last words palamon
 one yet loves thee dying

 arcite
 take emilia
 worlds joy reach thy hand
 farewell told last houre false
 yet never treacherous forgive cosen—
 one kisse faire emilia tis done
 take die

 palamon
 thy brave soule seeke elizium

 emilia
 ile close thine eyes prince blessed soules thee
 thou art right good man live
 day give teares

 palamon
 honour

 theseus
 place first fought evn
 sundred acknowledge gods
 thankes living
 part playd though short
 well day lengthned
 blissefull dew heaven dos arowze
 powerfull venus well hath gracd altar
 given love master mars
 hath vouchd oracle arcite gave
 grace contention deities
 shewd due justice beare hence

 palamon
 cosen
 things desire doe cost us
 losse desire nought could buy
 deare love losse deare love

 theseus
 never fortune
 play subtler game conquerd triumphes
 victor losse yet passage
 gods beene equall palamon
 kinseman hath confest right oth lady
 lye first saw
 even proclaimd fancie restord
 stolne iewell desird spirit
 send hence forgiven gods justice
 take hand become
 executioners leade lady
 call lovers stage death
 adopt frinds day two
 let us looke sadly give grace unto
 funerall arcite whose end
 visages bridegroomes weele put
 smile palamon houre
 one houre since dearely sorry
 glad arcite glad
 sorry heavenly charmers
 things make us lacke
 laugh sorry still
 children kind let us thankefull
 leave dispute
 question lets goe
 beare us like time florish exeunt

 epilogue

 would aske ye ye like play
 schoole boyes say
 cruell fearefull pray yet stay
 let looke upon ye man smile
 goes hard see
 lovd yong hansome wench show face—
 tis strange none heere—and
 conscience let hisse kill
 market tis vaine see stay yee
 worst come say ye
 yet mistake bold
 cause tale told
 tis way content ye
 honest purpose ment ye
 end ye shall ere long
 dare say many better prolong
 old loves us might
 rest service gentlemen good night florish

 v

 fair love fair fickle
 mild dove neither true trusty

 softer wax yet iron rusty

 none fairer none falser deface

 many tales please hath coind
 dreading love loss thereof still fearing
 yet midst pure protestings
 faith oaths tears jestings

 burnd love soon straw outburneth

 bade love last yet fell turning

 bad best though excellent neither

 rape lucrece



 right honourable henry wriothesly

 earl southampton baron titchfield

 love dedicate lordship without end whereof
 pamphlet without beginning superfluous moiety warrant
 honourable disposition worth untutored
 lines makes assured acceptance done
